Copied in the changes from the Shotwell vapi files and fixed up and tested the associated vala. All of these code changes relate to importing and previewing files from a camera which I've just tested still works with my Pixel 4a. I also changed how the image-missing icon is loaded in the import page as this was not working and causing criticals in the terminal. This should get us some memory leak fixes as we've now got rid of a lot of the manual memory management that wasn't done right anyway.

Handle the SMOOTH_SCROLL events to enable smooth scrolling.
Description: As the per-direction mousewheel events have been propagated to subclasses, and the smooth scroll (since 3.4) can have multiple directions (see [1]), check the delta values and propagate for all directions (at most two, one vertical and one horizontal scroll). [1] https://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/gdk3-Event-Structures.html#GdkScrollDirection

Changes sidebar icons to system icons
Enable auto-import by default to fix bug #1261094
Enable auto-import by default to fix bug #1261094
Remove menubar items already present in UI
Merge po files, set up for intltool and l10n.gnome.org
Description: This removes the custom .pot file setup we had before, making it easy to translate Shotwell using the standard intltool workflow. This also merges the two separate core/extras gettext domains into one, to keep things simple.  I hope I've merged all the po files correctly, but I wouldn't bet money I did it perfectly. We also set up the help to be able to be translated on l10n.gnome.org. Closes: bgo #718783

Message: Add translator comments for strftime strings: Refs bgno#716533
Description: The strftime strings for local-specific date/time formats are cryptic, so hopefully these comments will help translators make the right choice.

Message: Crash in video interpretable check: Closes #5071
Description: The database and ThumbnailCache calls in check_is_interpretable are not thread-safe although check_is_interpretable was being called from a background thread.  Now check_is_interpretable returns an object with a foreground_finish() function that does the thread- unsafe work there.

GNOME's pre-commit hooks discovered a couple of gettext problems in three translations.  This removes (by hand) the c-format specifiers that were causing the problem as well as adds the no-c-format comments in the code so the problem doesn't happen again. Finally, msgfmt -c is now used to catch these errors in the future, although the Makefile doesn't abort (like it should) when that happens.  More work necessary for that.

Message: Correct language codes of PO files
Description: Also fuzzify invalid translations, otherwise git.gnome.org won't let me commit.
To follow the convention.

Message: Tumble plugin doesn't show authentication pane: Closes #7691
Description: Glade files were not being installed by Makefile nor included in the tarball.

Message: Importing to library with limited rights fails: Closes #7550
Fix Makefile error if VALAC is defined: Closes #7650
Bump packaging version for latest gexiv2
Create AppData directory before installing file: Closes #7583
Don't re-open stdout in thumbnailer: Closes #7580
Description: Causes an SELinux policy violation.

Message: Fixed validation problem in AppData file
Crop tool sanity-checks its GSettings: Closes #7359
Description: In the ticket, the user's last-chosen crop setting was a separator, leading to havoc.

Message: Update debian/control for new gphoto2 package name
Description: For libgphoto2 2.5, the package name was changed in Saucy.

Message: Revert minimum requirement to Vala 0.20.1: Closes #7537
Description: Since enabling deprecated in main app, might as well enable deprecated in plugins.  This allows for us to revert back to a minimum Vala requirement of 0.20.1, which is convenient for Ubuntu.
Also now includes potgen-shotwell script, which generates the .pot files.  "make pot_file" will execute it automatically. Script also included in tarball.  Closes #7526

Message: shotwell-video-thumbnailer fails to gen thumbnails: Refs #7258
Description: Removing bpp and depth params from gstreamer call, as recommended at https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=708034#c4

Message: Cropped or straighten portraits stretched at export: Closes #7035
Description: Also deals with #6945, which reported the problem for publishing to Facebook.

Message: Videos not moved out of Missing Files when reimported: Closes #7462

Description: Also related to #7486
Related to #7486, forgot to bump up the valac version minimum.

Message: Memory usage to high when exporting photos: Closes #7115
Help -> Report a Problem sends user to login page: Closes #6946

Description: Bumps gee-0.8 minimum requirement to 0.8.5.

Message: Crash when importing AVI file: Closes #7413
Description: Fixes some unsafe scanf() parameters.

Message: Make Paste Color Adjustments sensitive when copied: Closes #7406
Change Copy Color Adjustments sensitivity when photo alt: Closes #7405

Description: Deprecations were libsoup symbols when compiling the plugins.  The main app is already building with deprecations enabled.
User can now add a "is media modified" criteria to a saved search.

Message: Copy and paste color adjustments: Closes #2517
Description: Color adjustments now have a "clipboard" that can be copied to and pasted from.

Message: Use less memory when loading camera previews: Refs #2959
Description: Reduces memory usage by loading images at scaled size when preview is unavailable.

Message: Crop tool improvements: display crop dimensions: Refs #6358
Description: Crop tool displays its unscaled dimensions in the center of the recticle when moving or resizing it. This does not close the ticket, as a separate issue remains to be implemented (cropping to specific pixel dimensions).

Message: Wrong date for Pentax K-5 AVI: Closes #7054
Description: An improved date-parsing routine to help eliminate future issues with oddball date formats in videos.

Message: Reduce CPU usage when importing w/ Camera developer: Closes #6812
./configure flag to disable desktop-ffile-validate check: Closes #6820
Resolve symlinked argv[0] path when determining run loc: Closes #7181
Remember location of editing tool windows: Closes #7264
Description: Locations are only stored in memory, not persisted.  Moving the Shotwell window will reset the stored locations. Also, development of this patch uncovered some subtle bugs in StraightenTool, which are now fixed.

Message: Avoid assert() with random slideshow transitions: Closes #7323
Description: If no slideshow plugins are enabled, default to null transition rather than assert.
GtkSearchEntry (#6093) requires GTK+ 3.6.

Message: Show previews when importing from memory card: Closes #2959
Description: Uses fallback code to load metadata through alternate means (i.e. GVFS) when unable to load through GPhoto itself.

Message: Make "No Event" icon not look like an error: Closes #4824
Update Daily Build PPA to use Vala 0.21.1
Folder entries in sidebar updated when folder deleted or renamed: Closes #6455
Doesn't build with Vala 0.21.1, "close" conflict in GTK 3.10: Closes #7295, Closes #7254
Description: The number of deprecated classes and methods in GTK 3.10 is too much work simply to get Shotwell to compile, so that's been moved to #7301.  This patch fixes some "hard" compile errors and disables warnings for deprecated symbols.

Message: Closes #7028 Revert back to Glib 2.30, bump Gtk version in debian control file
Support standard --prefix and --libdir configure arguments: Closes #6931
Using the "&" character in Picasa uploader causes upload to fail: Closes #6141

Description: LibRaw 0.15 removed document-mode processing, which, as their release notes say, "no one uses".  Compile error were nothing more than missing symbols -- Shotwell wasn't using it either.

Message: Improper French date format in sidebar: Closes #6939
This should fix the daily build breakage. Let's hold off on closing the corresponding ticket, however, 'til we can confirm that daily builds work again.
Make the event context menu and comment-editing dialog inform the user they'll be editing the event's comment. Fixes #6898.
Implements a highlights detail slider in the color adjustment palette to complement the preexisting shadow detail slider. Closes #752.
Delivery deftly dodges dreaded delegate duplication discouragement disaster; ref #6893.

Removes useless Glade UI files and lines of support code from the Picasa and YouTube connectors that are no longer necessary now that both connectors use the shared services of the GoogleService family of utility classes in RESTSupport.vala. Closes #6924.
Uses more specific language to describe the "strip metadata" option across all four of the core web connectors. Closes #6922 and #6923.
Removed stray 'new' keywords when initializing GLib.Mutex and GLib.Cond (both are structs); ref #6893.

Simplifies the Picasa Connector dramatically by rewriting to make use of the GoogleService support classes developed for the YouTube connector. Enables in-app hosted web authentication in the Picasa Connector. Closes #6907.
Migrate to new officially-blessed cosntructor for ThreadPool; ref #6893.
Adds support for editing the comment of an event from inside the event's page and sidebar context menu. Fixes #6904.
Fixes a problem in which the YouTube Connector would not properly cancel uploads. Closes #6908.
Factors hosted OAuth support out the YouTube connector and into a series of service-neutral utility classes. Closes #6888
Replaces a deprecated widget in CustomComponents; ref #6893.
Replaces a deprecated constant with an allowed one; fixes #6891.
Corrects a problem where extended info wouldn't display for videos; ref #6887.
Tries to migrate the colour-adjust tool window to use a Grid instead of a table; ref #5838.
Upgrades the YouTube connector to use OAuth 2 authentication, including in-app authentication via a hosted Webkit pane. Closes #3445.
Migrate the export dialogue box away from using Table and onto Grid instead. Ref #5838.
Adds a check to see whether the event is null before trying to extract a comment from it; ref #6878.
Tries to merge smaller events onto larger ones whenever possible, reducing the number of operations that have to be done to complete the merge; part of ref #979 (see comment 24).

Shotwell now builds again with the --unity-support flag; corrects an issue where the .deps files accompanying the custom Shotwell .vapi files were not included in the distribution tarball. Closes #6859.
Migrates Shotwell's entire codebase, including plugins, to libgee-0.8. Tested with both of the (slightly different) versions of libgee that ship with Quantal and Raring, respectively. Closes #867.
Fixes an issue in which the sidebar was not properly styled. Closes #6839.
Works around a problem in glib where two on-disk directories could have different filenames that collated to the same collation key; fixes #6825.
Precaches the exposure time of Photo objects in order to speed up certain operations with them. Partial fix for ref #979.
Makes saved searches aware of photo comments. Closes #6541.
Displays the current git SHA in the Shotwell runtime log. Invaluable for debugging with users that have built from git master. Closes #3655.
Adds a configure option that allows building the Shotwell executable with profiling support. Closes #6805.
Forces '_modified's exported from camera raw images to have correct orientation. Fixes #6536.
Fixes an issue where duplicating a photo without an associated event would generate a soft assertion. Closes #6810.
Fixes an issue where the key photo for an event could appear blurry in the event overview if the key photo had an extreme aspect ratio. Closes #1202.
Corrects an incorrect addition to the THANKS file.
Fixes an issue where Shotwell failed to start when installed a certain way on Fedora systems using the new Red Hat Unified Directory Structure. Closes #5181.
Uses new EXIF metadata fields, including mapping from ratings stars to percents. Closes #5451.
Changes saved search and search filter logic such that it ignores diacritical marks (this is to say, the character 'é' is equivalent to 'e'). Closes #6670.
Fixes a grammatical error in the flagging photos progress dialog box. Closes #6457.
Migrates the slideshow settings dialog away from table and into grid; part of #5838.
Migrates the extended info window away from a table and into a grid as required by #5838.
Corrects a problem where creating a new event from items highlighted in the library page wouldn't cause the app to navigate to the new event.  Fixes #6728.
Increases performance of the folder tree view. Closes #6715.
Updates NEWS and debian/changelog files in preparation for Shotwell 0.14.1 release.
Corrects a problem where pressing [Shift] while viewing an image whose original orientation was anything other than top-left would cause the image to 'snap' to top-left inappropriately; fixes #6734.
The new Graph API-based Facebook Connector correctly sets the privacy level on video uploads. Closes #6694.

Fixes a translation issue in the Greek translation introduced by my most recent round of translation pulls from Transifex. Special thanks to Joe Bylund for spotting this as I clearly overlooked it when integrating the latest round of translations. Closes #6713.
Updates translations in anticipation of the Shotwell 0.14.1 release.
Fixes a missing mnemonic in direct-edit mode; fixes #6696
Updates the Facebook Connector to robustly recover from type 7 and type 8 errors. Closes #6586.
Corrects a problem with 013588718406e2749f7f3b6910a1dce3770113f7 where the Makefile would try to validate the .desktop file before checking whether the desktop validator was actually installed.
Prevent the app from jumping from the library page to an event if an image is dragged there; fixes #4014.
Corrects an issue where the makefile blithely assumed that all computers would already have desktop-file-utils installed; ref #6691.
Fixes a capitalization and punctuation error in the German translation file. Closes #6690.
Runs 'desktop-file-validate' on the generated .desktop files and dies early during build time if there's a problem; fixes #6570.
Description: (Also corrects a problem with misc/shotwell-viewer.desktop.head)

Message: Revert "Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585." (should not have been pushed)
Description: This reverts commit 547e2251fe0cff819b729fb79415f165d8ed9941.

Message: Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585.
Preserve the orientation field for .JPGs when exporting them with stripped metadata; ref #6684.
Changes the way displaying the unmodified version of a photo is handled to use the precache and avoid a crash in direct mode; ref #6236.
Ensures that the icon associated with the startup progress dialog is the Shotwell application icon; closes #6641.
Removes all hard dependencies on X11 libraries, making Shotwell display-server agnostic and able to run under Weston/Weyland. Closes #6606.
Adds corrupt image errors to the family of errors detected by the import logging system. Closes #6445.
Makes 'configure' smarter about handling the case where no compatible libGPhoto2 installation is found; fixes #6579.
For raw files, don't use the embedded preview on the photo page if it's less than 1024 px along its major axis; closes #6594.
Fixes strftime strings that generated bogus dates in the Catalan translation. Closes #3943.
Forces the search filter to propagate to checkerboard pages when they're switched to, more closely matching what the user intuitively expects. Fixes #4300.
Updates French translation in preparation for the 0.14.0 release.
Modifies the video reader to ignore auxilliary video container files that come as part of AVCHD bundles. Closes #4943.
Adds missing command line options to the manpage. Closes #3998.
Fixes a bug in the Portuguese translation that affected generation of the .desktop file.

Changes the semantics of "unsetting" a configuration key in the GSettings configuration engine to mean "reset the GSettings key to its default value." In the past, unsetting was a no-op. Closes #6578.
Changes error handling sequence in response to token refresh failures in Picasa connector to ensure users whose client IDs were changed by the previous commit are properly logged out.
Changes Picasa client ID and client secret in attempt to interoperate better with UOA.
Fixes a serious issue in which the endpoint test HTTP transaction run against the Facebook login server would fast-fail, preventing new users from logging into Facebook. Closes #6546.
Fixes numerous translation glitches and re-versions translation files to 0.14.0 in anticipation of the upcoming Shotwell 0.14 release. Closes #6431, #6424, and #6127.
Increases the time Shotwell allows the shotwell-video-thumbnailer helper process to run before killing it. Mitigates some GStreamer 1.0 issues. Closes #6519.
Corrects a problem where the extended properties box could show stale information after a raw was highlighted, then de-selected. Fixes #6500.

The video thumbnailer now seeks to a fixed value of 1 second into the video's duration in all cases. Previously, it seeked to a timecode that was determined dynamically by taking a percentage of the total video length.
Corrects a problem where .BMPs couldn't be rotated correctly if metadata-writing were turned on; fixes #3845.
Consumes 'F2' keypresses when nothing is selected in an event to prevent the sidebar from acting on them; fixes #4436.
Relaxes an assertion that could fail while removing media sources from a view tracker (and logs the condition that causes the assertion); fixes #6481.
Update debian/changelog for Daily Build PPA
Replaces an assertion with a short-circuit return and a debug message. Closes #5155.
Prevents the background-task progress bar from appearing if there are too few tasks pending to justify it; fixes #2512.
Relaxes an assertion that could occasionally fail in the SourceHoldingTank, as well as adds some logging for the problem to help us address it in the future; ref #3981.
Updates version number in Makefile and translation files for the Shotwell 0.14.0PR1 pre-release.
Works around a problem where a TreeSet could leak references when going out of scope (this led to a leak and crash in Geary); fixes #6478.
Allows compilation with both valac 0.18.x and 0.19.x. Closes #6406.
Fixes an issue where charset annotations could migrate their way into the content text of photo comments. Closes #6359.
Patch adds a progress bar dialogue if more than 1000 media sources are being flagged or unflagged at once. Fixes #2937.
Proposed patch would make it possible to change the raw developer from the context menus; fixes #4058.
Causes the 'undated' entry to remain at the next-to-last part of the list, right before 'no event'. Ref #1632.
Fixes an issue in which Shotwell was unable to produce thumbnails for -- and thus import -- photos generated by a recent-model Blackberry camera. Closes #6053.
Makes the search/filter bar's visibility state a persistent property, so Shotwell now remembers whether the search/filter toolbar is visible between runs. Closes #6416.
Corrects a problem where the 'Shotwell' development could be inappropriately rotated twice for portrait camera-raw images; fixes #4262.
Corrects an issue where the master's orientation could be inappropriately written to after an external edit; fixes #6430
Ensures that rejected photos are not visible at startup. Closes #4300.
Instead of rotating the pixels and dimensions on export, if we're being asked to write a JPEG, we write the pixels normally and let the orientation field do the rotation for us, fixes #1938.
Description: NOTE: this does not fix the case where reverting after an external editor has set the _modified.jpg to top-left; this was broken out into its own bug.

Message: Updates POT files in the wake of the Shotwell 0.14 string freeze to prepare for the upcoming release.
Allows uploading of event comments to Piwigo. Closes #6381.
Adds three additional slideshow transition effects. Closes #6411.
Makes permissions problems leading to write failures show up under manifest.write_failed; closes #5786.
Proposed patch would add the path to the currently-displayed development for a raw file to the extended information window; closes #6408.
Adds special-case, date and time correction logic that works around a date encoding problem present in some HTC Android phones. Closes #3314.
Proposed patch would show the filesize of the master raw, rather than the development, in extended info; closes #6407.
Prevents multiple spurious copies of the same image from being generated when the developer is changed; closes #5681.

Uses sort-by-title as a fallback when the configuration system (GSettings or GConf) gives an invalid sort criteria value. This is a major improvement over the previous behavior where Shotwell would error out and crash. Closes #6253.
Adds a random slideshow transition. Closes #6275.
Modified the text on the straighten tool's affirmative button, fixes #4822.
Proposed patch would put these in the right place the next time the .pot generator is run; closes #5973.
Allows the user to save a detailed log of any import complications (duplicates, file errors, etc.). Closes #2593 and #3126.
Corrected a typo that broke compilation.
Corrects a problem where the developer in the photo row could be re-set inappropriately after deleting a stale development .jpeg; closes #6390.
Checks whether we're running on an RTL locale or not, and if so, flips the arrow glyph before adding it to the affected string; fixes #5900.
Fixes some broken pango markup in ja.po; ref #6385.
Adds support for uploading photo comments to the Piwigo Connector.
Displays seconds in photo exposure date/time in the extended information pane. Closes #5709.
Fixes a UI nit in which the "Edit Title" and "Edit Tags" dialogs failed to conform to the GNOME HIG. Closes #6262.
Fixes a variety of user experience nits related to adding comments to photos and events. Closes #6353.
Adds four additional core slideshow transitions. Closes #6347.
Shotwell no longer runs the gsettings-data-convert tool on startup. Closes #6369 and #6252.
Fixes up 'stale' RAW thumbnails that were generated by older, buggier versions of Shotwell when the developer was set to 'camera'; ref #6315.
Fixes a Raring-specific crash in the new, Graph API-based Facebook Connector. Closes #6345.
Adds the capability to annotate events with comments. Closes #6271.
Adds a breadcrumb comment to a seemingly-unusual snippet of code in EditingTools.vala.

Adds all of the user's photo albums to the album selector list in the publishing options pane of the Facebook Connector regardless of the value of the Facebook can_upload flag for that album. This change may need to be undone later as Facebook policies change.
Changes the way the startup progress bar calculates progress percentage. Closes #3572.
Fixes up raw developer on images imported from a camera after importing is complete; fixes #4149, fixes #4692.
Re-implements support for publishing videos and mixed media (photos and videos) to Facebook. Closes #6312.
Increases the size of the Edit Title, Add Tags, and Modify Tags dialogs, making entry of long titles or many tags much easier. Closes #6313.
Migrates the Facebook Connector to the new Graph API. Closes #4110, #5873, #6111, #6103.
Makes the 'extended information' window display the path to the master file, rather than the currently-displayed one; closes #4137 .
Causes a null string set to be considered equal to an empty one, since it follows that they both have 0 elements. Closes #4297.
Prevents the application from inappropriately renaming 'sister' JPEG files -and- forces the application to always prefer the camera development over the embedded one if it's available; closes #4149.

Description: This is technically not required for building Shotwell, but we want to move automated packaging builds now and in the future to newer versions.

Message: Implements a major new feature: the ability to add comments to photos. Closes #1573.
Corrects a problem in which pushing the left arrow key mapped to a rightward transition to the previous photo in the slideshow view. Closes #6258.
Displays a more user-friendly error message when the Vala compiler is not present or is the wrong version. Closes #1856.
Prevents inappropriate deletion of camera-generated raw developments, closes #4207, closes #6238.
Fixes a build system issue in which the GSchema XML files would not be properly recompiled. Closes #6178.
Adds icons to the publishing service selector drop-down menu; closes #1321.
Expands the set of desktop keywords. Closes #6075.
Causes the application to regenerate a missing raw development as needed; closes #6237.
Makes the folders view in the sidebar recursively display folder contents. Closes #6211.
Fixes a French translation issue. Closes #6213.
Copies the Tumblr publishing service icon to the appropriate system resource directory when "make install" is invoked. Closes #6242.
Deletes 'stale' development .jpg when the user switches RAW developers*; closes #4141.
Description: *...if and only if the 'stale' image is not a user-supplied/camera-created one (to wit, the JPEG file of a RAW+JPEG pair).

Message: Prevents the library directory itself from getting deleted as we walk up the parent tree; closes #6241.
Updates copyrights to 2013 across all source files, translations, and custom vapis. Closes #6194.
Causes video thumbnails to get regenerated if lost; closes #6152.
Description: Also moves some code around so regeneration for both stills and videos happens in the same spot, improving code navigability.

Message: Makes text entry dialogs resizable. Closes #6097.
Implements a basic folder tree in the sidebar. Closes #1594.
Corrects a problem where ./configure would blithely accept bogus arguments; closes #6015.
Increases MIN_VALAC_VERSION to the earliest version of valac that ships with vapi files for GStreamer 1.0.
Fixes an issue where we were supplying an invalid argument to the configure script; closes #6016.
Allows selection of a sub-album or category when publishing to Piwigo. Closes #3749.
Allows the user to show & hide the sidebar. Closes #5346.
Prevents file discovery and metadata writing from starting before ALL initialization, including tag list population, is completed.
Description: Fixes #5992.

Message: Modifies thumbnail cache system to correctly support multiple libraries. Closes #5986.
Adds Joseph Bylund to the THANKS file.
Modifies RAW photo development logic to properly copy original photo metadata into generated developments. Closes #4372.
Allows the user to suppress the upload of tags when publishing to Piwigo. Closes #6156.
Made sure that the required versions in debian/control match what's in Makefile. Fixes #5965.
Updates the help documentation to correct an outdated help entry.
Flattens hierarchical tags before publishing them to Picasa. Closes #5909.
Adds the ability to use the Shotwell title of a photo as its Piwigo description instead of its Piwigo title. Closes #5999.
Updates version number to 0.13.1+trunk, merges in changes to NEWS and debian/changelog from the 0.13.1 release.
Uninstalls the filter when the search bar is dismissed; fixes #5912.
Attempts to guard against obviously-malformed XML responses -and- checks whether the freshly-parsed Xml.Doc* has zero children; closes #5822, closes #5907.

Changes the logic of spin_event_loop() such that it is the same as the canonical form for interstitial event processing as described in the Gtk+ 3 documentation (see http://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/gtk3-General.html#gtk-events-pending). Closes #5844.
Forces the search bar to be visible whenever the star filter is changed from the menus; closes #5912.
Removes a bit of unneeded code that worked around a no-longer-existant binding problem.
Tries to use Gtk.Application.inhibit() and friends instead of calling directly into dbus; closes #5903.
Closes #4523; corrects an issue where the parent directory of the desired import location would occasionally be seen as the import location.
Suppresses spinning the event loop during one of the two status reporting callbacks made during the export process. Closes #5827.
Don't attempt to restore the cursor if there are 0 thumbnails in the current checkerboard; closes #5919.
Fixes an error in the German shotwell-core translation file; closes #5931.
Migrates the print dialogue's custom image settings tab to Glade; part of #5838.
Adds missing semicolons to Arabic, Spanish, Chinese-TW and German .po files; closes #5860.
Description: Many thanks to Damien Lallement for his gracious help.

Message: Closes #5050, closes #5086; moves the settings migrator someplace sensible, causes the migrator to clean up old paths.
Moves the Piwigo schema to be with the other core publishing plugins' schemata; closes #5646
Proposed patch would fix #3520, #5160; explicitly whitelists some more common video storage paths for Sony cameras.
Corrects a problem where a signal callback could inadvertently get disconnected after the object the signal lived in was destroyed; closes #5841.
Updates master Makefile version number to 0.13.0+trunk
Updated NEWS, debian/changelog, and Makefile to prepare for 0.13.0 release.

Simplifies debian/control by removing phantom libunity dependency, removing unnecessary runtime dependencies already managed by shlibs:Depends, and adds a dconf-tools runtime dependency for the gsettings migrator tool. Closes #5853, #5852, #5851.
Updated Shotwell Extra Plugins translations for the Shotwell 0.13 release.
Updates the Shotwell core translation set for the Shotwell 0.13 release.
Causes rejected photos to not be chosen as event thumbnails (unless the event contains nothing but rejected photos); closes #3682.
Allows the application to build with Vala 17.7; closes #5803.
Closes #5774; corrects an error where the library window would incorrectly assume all pages it was handling were checkerboard pages.
Closes #5050; moves settings path to /org/yorba/shotwell and copies over old settings data from /apps/.
Allows time and date strings to be drawn from the locale in LC_TIME if it's different from the one in LC_MESSAGES; closes #2462.
Removes test to see whether incoming photo is in pending or not; closes #5761.
Re-closes #5160; adds support for some Sony cameras that put stills in DCIM, but videos in /PRIVATE/SONY/...
Proposed patch would ensure key commands get propagated from full-screen mode to other parts of the app correctly; closes #3883.
Adds a Keywords entry to the desktop integration file template. Closes #5550.
Fixes a build breakage that occurs with valac 0.17.6. Re-closes #5431.
Adds support for Tumblr publishing to the Shotwell Extras plugin pack. Closes #5431.
Added NEWS and changelog entries for 0.12.90; closes #5763.
Closes #5744; Corrects an issue where the border around the histogram  would render incorrectly
Description: on Ubuntu 12.10 with Ambiance and Radiance.

Message: Fixes an inconsistently formatted string pointed out by a user (Roumano) on the mailing list.
Removes reference to Vala 0.10-specific directory; closes #5194.
Prevents critical assertions from firing when the Adjust tool is spawned; closes #5704.
Skips out on changing to the import page for cameras added during the initial population of the camera table; closes #5717.
Updates the Straighten Tool icon with a new version that features simpler lines and more closely matches the Shotwell toolbar color palette.
Fixes #1550 by writing log messages to stderr when not previously done.
Description: log_file_stream gets only set if a file is used, then all messages will be written in the file. If log_file_stream is null (means problem with opening the file) the messages will be written to stdout and stderr so no need to write them again to stderr.

Message: Added Tobe Deprez to the THANKS file.
Adds the ability to display photo titles during slideshows. Closes #1592.
Resolves minor issue where wrong signal was disconnected in "Flagged" sidebar branch
Incrementing version number in preparation for #5698.
Prevents direct mode from crashing; closes #5702.
Prevents the application from crashing with a SIGSEGV on exit; closes #5701.
Ensure that the changes made for #5553 get propagated to any tarballs we generate; part of #5698.
Allows undated images to automagically move to the correct event when time/date info is added to them; closes #1940.
Allows building against both libgphoto2 2.4.x and 2.5.x; closes #5589.

Require libraw 0.13.2 or higher.  Fixes #3062.  Fixes #3534.

Message: Corrects an issue where the timer in the publishing UI could get into an inconsistent state if the user tried to publish with no plugins enabled; closes #4929.
The Flickr LegacyPublishingOptionsPane no longer attempts to access the state of a widget that is indeterminate for video-only uploads. Closes #4928.
Fixes tool window positioning in direct mode; closes #4902.
Eliminates a situation where a malicious user could stop other users on the same system from being able to publish photos by taking ownership of certain directories in the /tmp tree. Closes #4411.
Fixes spelling and formatting issues in debug log output.
Fixes a mismatch in the ISO language and region codes for Slovenian between Shotwell and Facebook. Allows Slovenian users to login to Facebook inside Shotwell in their native language. Closes #4291.
Adds a guard condition to prevent TagTable.upgrade_for_htags( ) from running when version 14 (Shotwell 0.11.x) databases are upgraded to version 15 (Shotwell 0.12.x).
Closes  #4771,  rearranges the grid slightly to prevent unwanted blurring.
Eliminates the global shared adjustment for all page sliders. Closes #4886.
Makes the default width for the sidebar slightly higher to fix a problem where default event names could appear truncated
Description: if the user's default font was either Ubuntu  11 or Cantarell 11 (common defaults for recent Ubuntu and Fedora installations).

Message: Fixed #4885 (A crash occurs if an unhighlighted tag in the sidebar is right-clicked upon).

Tweaks auto-enhance behavior to make shadow correction less aggressive and reduces the number of contexts in which shadow correction is applied. Closes #3435.
Fixed #4562 (single shared menu for all Shotwell views) and #4841 (sidebar and menu flash during import).
Description: With this change the LibraryWindow's UI Manager is shared by all pages in the window.  When you switch to any page, it swaps the menus and toolbars it needs into the shared UI manager, and then swaps them back out when you leave the page. Many of the changes here were because pages were assuming that their widgets existed even when pages were not in view.  With these changes, pages can access widgets only when they are active.

Message: Closes #4875 and #4874, fixes various UI annoyances with the straighten tool.

Message: Removed broken tooltip on Merge Events button.  Partially fixes #4825.
Fixed #4684 (some thumbnails grayed out on startup).
Description: The thumbnail fetching code was sometimes deadlocking in code which held a lock while constructing a singleton JfifFileFormatDriver or JfifFileFormatProperties object.  Vala was unfortunately initializing the lock only when the first instance of the class was created, which could be when one or more threads had already acquired and were waiting on the lock.  So these threads never continued execution after the lock was freed.  I solved the problem by eliminating the lock in these and similar classes.  We now call a static init() method earlier instead.

Handles the case in which an F-Spot database can become deformed whereby fields become null that should never be null, since F-Spot's developers never set NOT NULL constraints on these rows in their SQL DDL code. Improves handling of cases where F-Spot backing photos are unavailable. Closes #4487.

Closes #4613, #4614 and #4615, as well as slightly improving responsiveness of some editing tools; when preparing to work with an image, we now precache a full-sized copy of how it looks prior to modification, operate on a copy of that, and then scale the result, rather than attempting a fetch every time the pipeline is run.

The outstanding problem involves the "prelight" or "hover" state of the search bar buttons. This state appears unresponsive to styling using either the CSS or legacy APIs. I'll be in communication with some of the Gtk+ devs over the next few days to see how we can force this state to by styled.

Improves visual styling of the new, GTK+ 3-compatible histogram component on Oneiric.
Restores the Adjust Palette histogram control to full functionality under GTK+ 3. Closes #3869.
Closes #3566, saves the most-recently-chosen crop options to GSettings
Description: when OK is clicked, then restores them and simulates a UI event when the  crop tool is activated again.

Message: Closes #4025, removes the resize grip from all application windows.
Closes #4188, removes the hybrid engine, all GConf functionality, and dependencies on gconf2 and libgconf2-dev.
Now builds with (and requires) Vala 0.14: Closes #3760
Description: Mostly grunt-work to ensure that all delegates may be stored as unowned refs and that all out parameters are assigned prior to exiting the method.  One binding change (Gdk.EventAny) makes these changes incompatible with 0.12.
This enables Shotwell to build and run under GTK+3.  Note there are many outstanding bugs caused by this move; they will be dealt with in separate commits.

Message: Fixes #4148, changed "RAW + JPEG" to read "RAW+JPEG" in user-facing strings.
Fixes #4151, tells the error pane to wrap its text properly.
Updates the NEWS and debian/changelog for the Shotwell 0.11.2 release.
added max valac version, +trunk to version
Closes #4147 by adding the appropriate Pango markup here to make the text smaller.
Properly traps Facebook session expiration following the shift to OAuth. Closes #4153.
Inserts proper checks for root tag form. Closes #4150.
Makes dragging a top-level tag to the "Tags" grouping a no-op. Closes #4145.
Changes implementation of the ReparentTagCommand such that it now properly handles merge operations involving top-level tags. Closes #4127 and #4128.
Closes #4099. The application now reaps orphaned tags automatically,
Description: preventing them from crashing via the sidebar tree-graft assertion.

Message: Crash fixed when undoing tag merge: #4129
Description: When undoing a complex series of tag merges and moves, Shotwell would regularly crash.  The reparent tag command was holding on to Tag objects during its lifetime.  Proxies would be better, but this is problematic because we can't use a proxy as a map key.  This patch uses the tag's path (as a string) instead of a ref to the Tag itself.

Message: Soft assertions during F-Spot import of duplicates: #4126
Description: I believe this could happen any time duplicates were detected during import.  This might solve other bugs where import is not reporting the right results.

Photos taken with Samsung NV10 have improper EXIF date/time format.  This patch allows for Shotwell to interpret them.  The reporter also had trouble with video creation time.  This doesn't appear to be an issue with Shotwell, as the dates were corrupted in the file. However, they exposed an overflow bug, which this patch corrects as well.

Message: Changes the way tag exclusion works; closes #4051.
Makefile now respects VALAC and LDFLAGS environment variables: #4123
Description: Courtesy Gavrilov Maksim.
This has proven to be difficult to reproduce, but I believe this patch fixes a problem where the progress dialog might be destroyed while inside its own monitor callback.

Message: Nautilus send-to no longer invoked if the user cancels the operation: #4121
Description: This has been around since Nautilus send-to was added.  Additionally, this fixes the same bug if the user cancels the operation to install multiple desktop backgrounds.

Message: Changes the way string replacement is done during tag rename and adds enhanced safety checks. Closes #4118.
Allows images to be published to Piwigo servers at several different preset sizes. Closes #3750.
Corrects item count errors involving mixed media (e.g., photos and videos) in the basic properties pane and the events directory page. Closes #4113.
Modifies the Facebook connector significantly to use OAuth for authentication. This definitively closes #4107 and #4018 and I'm highly confident it closes #3022 as well.
Double-clicking an event in the Events or a Year directory now moves cursor: #4114
Description: If the event being jumped to wasn't visible in the sidebar tree, the cursor would not move when jumping to a particular event.  It turns out the tree needs to be expanded to show the sidebar entry prior to moving the cursor.

Message: Relaxes a guard condition allowing F-Spot tags to be more aggressively sanitized. Closes #4081.
Closes #4108, makes sure we sanitize path components before adding them.
Closes #4030 by removing some checks whether we needed to re-sort or not that could break in unexpected ways.
Adds updated Chinese (Taiwan) and Ukrainian translations.
Removes an extraneous string in the POT file. Closes #4082.

Description: A configure option now allows the user to avoid installing the gsettings-data-convert file (shotwell.convert).  This is useful because the file must be installed in /usr/share/GConf/gsettings (and not /usr/local) for the program to locate it, which is a problem for folks who want to install as a user and not root. Also cleaned up the configure script help, which was still reflecting options no longer available.

Message: Re-closes 4061, removed the 'cannot import raw+jpeg from filesystem' blurb.
No longer need to install or compile GConf schemas.  Courtesy Vincent Untz.
Introduces enhanced tag state safety checks during import from F-Spot. Closes #4090 and #4081.
Solves several issues with tag duplication related to the Import from F-Spot feature.
4104 fix for sidebar null pointer crash
4093 photo duplicate now copies raw developments
4077 JPEG from trashed RAW+JPEG or editable is auto-imported on startup

Fixes a plethora of metadata writing and reimport issues. Closes #4096, #4074, #4071. Also fixes a previously unreported issue where undoing and redoing stacks of tag drag-and-drop operations could cause a segfault due to a missing null guard.
Refactors much of the HTags system so that it works properly with the proxy system. Closes #4039.
Closes #4076, disables editing if the currently-selected item is clicked, but reenables it if we've gotten either a 'rename' menu choice or an f2 keypress.
Closes #4061, adds info about enhanced RAW support and RAW+JPEG handling.
4089 Camera developed RAW images don't keep transformations between sessions
Description: The images were having their developers changed by the menu system. This is a result of the juggling between "camera" and "embedded" RAW developers we do to make this transparent to our users.

Message: 4069 exported camera-developed photo has wrong crop region
Crasher when duplicates of paired JPEG found in XDG Pictures directory: #4088
Description: Bounds-checking problem.

Message: 4064 transformations re-applied after undoing photo developer

Description: Because this value wasn't in the schema, the gsettings-data-convert program was aborting. This may fix #4072, but I can't reproduce it on my machine to start with.  This commit may also close #4056, but more investigation is required.

Message: Undoing parent tag remove now properly undoable: #4047
Description: Problem was that when a photo was detached from a Tag, that might result in numerous detaches from other Tags (namely, children of the parent being removed).  These need to be stored (and proxied) in the TagUntagCommand. Note that I also noticed some proxy problems in DeleteTag, and I've made some changes there as well.

Message: Closes #3887, causes the editing host page to use the dimensions of the photo whenever possible, preventing the unwanted scaling.
Corrects an issue in which the tag move operation (drag-and-drop) didn't take the number of child tag attachments for a given soure into account. Closes #4044.
4065 default developer set on all photos upon import
4063 opening a raw photo in single photo mode executes an undoable command
Dragging a tag onto itself is now a no-op. Closes #4036.
Makes dragging a tag to its parent a no-op. Closes #4035.
Disallows dragging a parent tag onto one of its children; closes #4045.
Makes the Tags grouping a proper drop source. Closes #4046.
4037 subtags and top-level tags can't have the same name
4038 don't prompt when deleting empty tag
Moving tag in heirarchy now undoable: #4034
Description: Problem was due to reparenting tag Command being executed but not added to the CommandManager stack. Note that this does not fix #4039, which Adam thought it might.

Message: Fixes part of 3887 by filling the entire background, rather than just the part beneath the image.
Description: The unrequested resize issue will be broken out into a separate ticket.

Message: added max valac version, +trunk to version
Adds the ability for Shotwell to interoperate with the Ubuntu Unity launcher progress bar. Closes #3992.
4012 Search filter bar on import page displays photo button as ungreyed when only RAW is present
Fixes an issue in which the Catalan translation used an invalid format specifier in its date format string. Closes #3943.
Updates language translation files for the Shotwell Extra Plugins. All translation files versioned at 0.11.0.
3968 further enhancements to monitoring raw files
3974 indicate RAW+JPEG in basic info pane
Fixed an issue with the updated Slovenian translation that caused msgfmt to yarf.
Updates all language translations for Shotwell Core. Translation files are versioned at 0.11.0
Closes #4004, makes text more explicit about the fact that %d and %m will produce day or month numbers with leading zeros.
Fixed an issue in which some UI files were not included in the distribution packages produced by "make dist."

Fixes an issue where some persistent publishing settings weren't saved. In fact, before this fix was applied, none of the shotwell-extras publishers were able to persist their settings at all. This issue was a side-effect of our GConf to GSettings migration. Closes #4006 and #3972.
Closes #4009, corrects some outdated URLs in Resources.vala.
3968 library monitor now works with RAW+JPEG
Closes #3964, adds information about new features and supported image types.
Changes the way sensitivity is determined for the "Export metadata" option in the export dialog. Closes #3988.
Fixes a problem in which an event sort order changed signal wasn't being fired by the HybridConfigurationEngine. Fixes #3979.
Closes #3275 by inserting an 8-pixel spacer between the rightmost edge of the zoom tool and the edge of the window.
Fixes an issue where the Yandex.Fotki publishing plugin didn't properly extract a session auth token.
Closes 3946 by moving the adjustment definition to before the hscale gets created.
RAW developer settings stored in wrong gsettings path: #3967
Description: This moves the RAW developer settings from the .ui path to the .files path in gsettings, which mimics where it was stored in GConf.

Message: Adds hierarchical tag support to the Import from F-Spot feature; closes #3328.
Fixes an issue where undoing an "Add Tags" operation would leave an orphan tag in the sidebar. Closes #3947.
Removes a diagnostic warning that is now superfluous given the change in the tag data model introduced with HTags. Closes #3954.
Closes 3999; removed debian/control.maverick as Ubuntu 10.10 is no longer officially supported.
Removes reference to library we don't actually use in the app anymore.
Fixes a critical problem where running hierarchical tags-enabled builds of Shotwell with older libraries having tags whose named contained slash characters caused a crash. Closes #3993.
3966 assertion on default sidebar context menu
Allows drag-n-drop of tags in the sidebar. Closes #3913.
Removed debug message from GConf -> gsettings conversion that was printing at each execution.

Description: This code will use gsettings-data-convert to move the user's GConf settings to gsettings when Shotwell executes.  It searches through gsettings-data-convert's keyfile to see if Shotwell's settings have been converted before spawning the process.
Persists the "hide photos already imported" checkbox on the camera import page.  Courtesy Jonas Bushart.

Message: 3880 Flickr uploads with apostrophe in title
Eliminates serious problems manipulating HTags through the "Add Tags" and "Modify Tags" dialog boxes. Closes 3956.
3671 (part 3) correction to pkg-config name of gstreamer-pbutils
3671 (part 2) fixed packaging issue related to Gst.Discoverer
3927 moved video re-thumbnailing to background thread in video monitor

Description: Gets a video date from GStreamer when we can't get a timestamp ourselves Adds new GStreamer dependency

Message: Closes 3939. Fixes an extremely subtle database bug related to HTags.
3931 Tags in sidebar has context menu to create a new top-level tag

Description: Now it's no longer shown. Additionally, the video length is corrected when the codec gets installed.

Message: 3904 Delete RAW+JPEG pair when deleting from a camera after import.
Click-in-region to edit Faces is broken under Unity: #3896
Description: This works around a Unity bug where the leave_notify_event is fired when the mouse pointer is still over the region.  The work around is to verify the mouse has indeed left the window before processing.  Courtesy Valentin Barros.

Message: Generated new POT files for the upcoming Shotwell 0.11 release.
Description: These POT files are versioned "Shotwell-0.10.90+trunk," indicating their anticipation of the Shotwell 0.11 release. The version number in the Makefile has also been updated to Shotwell-0.10.90+trunk.

Message: Implements basic hierarchical tag support. Closes #1401.

Description: Goof in the libraw-config script wasn't calling pkg-config correctly.  Thanks to Mike Auty for catching and fixing this.

Message: 2293 re-thumbnail videos when GStreamer cookie changes
Description: This fix: * Forces VideoMonitor to redo video thumbnails when the GStreamer cookie changes * Fixes a translatable string "todo" * Removes an unnecessary call to Video.init() * Provides a workaround for newly-discovered Vala bug #655594

Message: Added Timo Westkämper to THANKS file
1304 Shadows under photos. Contributed by Timo Westkämper

Description: This escapes text in a couple important places in the sidebar. It also escapes text in the dialogs that appear when you right-click on certain sidebar entries and hit "delete."

Message: Implements faces/people management in Shotwell. Closes #3894. Many THANKS to our GSoC student Valentin Barros!

Description: This eliminates a deadlock in BackgroundJob and moves the next/previous controls into SinglePhotoPage along with the hacky fix we have for when the user holds down the next/prev key. This does uncover two more issues, which I've filed tickets for. 1. The hacky fix is entirely time-dependent. On a slow enough computer it won't work. Ticket #3892 2. Slideshow transitions shouldn't be occurring when I use next/prev. It should just jump to the next photo asap. Ticket #3891

Message: Uses the plugin's service id instead of its name when storing the last used publishing plugin to the configuration system.
Description: Closes #3254.
Allows metadata to be optionally stripped when photos are exported from Shotwell.
Newer versions of libraw aren't initializing an out variable before returning.  Switching to ref solves the problem.  Courtesy Valentin David.

Message: 3866 fixed zoom in direct edit mode
3085 photo button in filter bar now excludes RAWs

Description: This adds handling for the Enter key in editing dialogs.  For crop and adjust, enter means OK. For redeye, enter is the same as close.
Adds a new Upgrades system

Fixes not one but TWO cases where photos appear rotated in direct mode. One is a simple "stomping on values" problem, the other is a more subtle race condition that only appears if you click fast enough when Shotwell loads.

Message: 3836 Show original now works with RAW
Description: Previously, the Shotwell developed photo would always be shown when pressing shift in single photo mode.  Now it will display the selected development.
Newly imported RAW photos are set to the developer set in the preferences dialog.

Message: Adds protection against GDK errors by forcing the crop region's boundaries to be inside the image's boundaries.
Description: (The crop box has to move when an image is straightened, and, under pathological  circumstances, one or more corners could end up outside the pixbuf; this forces the sub- pixbuf region we get after cropping to be fully within the image.)

Message: Closes 3840 by adding a range check to stop us from writing outside the pixel array.
3663 Simplified tag and search sidebar context menues
Description: This simplifies the sidebar context menus for saved searches and tags.  But it does oh-so-much-more!  It also removes a few translated strings that were not being used, and flips the order of the two options in the tag sidebar context menu so that Rename is before Delete to be more consistent with other parts of Shotwell.

This adds the ability to switch between Shotwell developed RAW images and camera developed RAW images. It will automatically group newly imported RAW+JPEG pairs, using the JPEG as the camera developed image when available.

Message: Fixes an issue introduced by commit e00236c79ff42b1e6cd7da627fc0c88c3cb97d55 in which Shotwell would build with Vala 0.12.1 but not with Vala 0.12.0

Description: Fixed a mismatch between null strings and empty strings in the configuration subsystem that caused setting a custom directory path to fail.

Message: 3755 crash while deleting last photo in fullscreen mode
3743 crash on startup when two events have the same name
3637 fixes assertion in fullscreen mode when pressing enter
Description: This takes care of an assertion in full screen mode.  All you have to do to hit this is go to full screen, hit Enter and then change to another photo (left, right, etc.) Why did this happen?  Well the LibraryPhotoPage interprets "Escape" and "Enter" as going back to the collection.  FullscreenWindow overrides Escape to mean leaving the full screen view; but it didn't handle Enter.  So what you were left with is a full screen view of your photo with no LibraryPhotoPage underneath.

Message: 3787 segmentation fault on tags selection from sidebar

Description: Mirroring now respects the comparator, additionally the view type must be set to DirectView.
Allows full-size uploads to Yandex.Fotki.

Message: 3667 - Adds ability to rotate an image by an arbitrary amount to the pipeline.
3529 "New Search" context menu on search branch
Description: ContextableEntry is refactored to Contextable so that context menus can be added to branches.
Fixes a plugin linkage problem that occurs on the Oneiric alpha.
Excludes the compiled GSettings schema file from Git version control.

Message: Fixes a minor Makefile issue introduced by the last commit. Fixes a regression introduced by the last commit in which the desktop background wouldn't be properly set on GNOME 3 systems.

Description: Enables use of either GConf or GSettings as a configuration backend.
Fixes an encoding glitch in the Piwigo publishing plugin. Thanks Bruno!

Message: Fixes an issue in which Glade resource files needed by the Piwigo publishing plugin weren't properly installed. Closes #3729.
3672 fixed opening raw photos in direct mode
Description: The format needs to be detected upfront; delaying this had unforseen consequences.  Since there's no other place in Shotwell where a format could change after import, it makes sense just to do it in the pre-pre-import step for direct mode.

Message: Corrected translations for any, all, and none.
3683 - Fixes artifacting that used to happen when resizing the window while the crop tool was open
Fixes an issue in which certain Makefile dependencies weren't checked prior to building any Shotwell component.
2059 refresh hide all imported filter when switching back to camera page
3656 - Prevents crashing by adding protection against drawing or sampling 0-pixel sized regions (GTK hates these).
3671 fall back to date provided by gstreamer for videos
Description: Also removes the direct calls to the GStreamer pipeline, replacing it with Gst.Discoverer provided in pbutils

Message: 2059 fixes for "hide already imported" on import page
Description: ViewCollections can now have multiple ViewFilters. In this case, the import page has both a search filter and a new filter that just does hide imported. Filename comparisons for video and RAW photos is now case insensitive, due to the lower-case on import feature.

Message: 3283 - we now get the master pixbuf here instead of the current one

Description: Modifies "make install" logic to make it compatible with the Gentoo packaging system.
Shotwell's crop tool now allows the crop reticle to pivoted regardless of the constraint setting.
Piwigo publisher now properly persists password between publishing sessions.
Fixes a regression in which a photo's title wasn't properly set when publishing to a Piwigo server.
Ensures Piwigo plugin doesn't attempt to create duplicate categories.

Message: Fixes an issue in which code and a documenation comment got out of sync, potentially confusing plugin authors.
3679 fixed crash when two or more cameras have the same name
3618 - makes 'x' come before 'y' when entering custom crop aspect ratio
3548 - Adds a sanity check query and automatic backup copying for photo.db

Description: Runs Shotwell core program pkg-config checks and prints useful error messages before attempting to build Shotwell plugins.
Ports Piwigo publishing connector to the new pluggable publishing API introduced in Shotwell 0.9.x.
Ports Piwigo publishing connector to the new pluggable publishing API introduced in Shotwell 0.9.x.

Message: 3654 Saved Search: text box re-appears when editing "is not set" search
3466 - react to Enter as well as KP_Enter here.

Description: This fixes a rather subtle crash left over from the sidebar refactoring.  Creating a new event always creates an undated event, then populates the date when the photos are added in a second step. But the code to add undated events accidentally had swapped the comparator (used to sort the undated events) between the parent and child.
Resolves a critical issue in which Shotwell could crash if publishing was cancelled during the file serialization phase.

Message: Added strings from ratings search to pot file.
3629 send-to with multiple users (and other multi-user /tmp bugs)
Description: Previously we used /tmp/shotwell for exporting temp files before e-mailing or publishing. The problem with this is that if multiple users are signed in to the same machine using Shotwell, only the first user to write to /tmp/shotwell will be successful since they own the write permissions to that folder. Rather than making the folder world-writable, we're now using the folder /tmp/shotwell-{uid} so each user has their own folder.

Message: 3547 - don't call export_fullsized_backing for non-lossy images, since they don't need it.
3617 - prevents user from entering zero as a crop ratio divisor or dividend
Description: and defends against several crashes that could result from weird custom crop ratios

Message: 3625 search filter no longer persists between sessions
Correctly adds external contributor of previous commit to THANKS file.
Closes #3007. Adds external contributor of patch (Alexandre Rosenfeld) to THANKS file.
3576 plugins can now differentiate between the title and the filename
3571 - Adds a close button for people using window managers or themes that don't expose 'close' in the titlebar.
3598 flickr upload where multiple photos have the same timestamp
Description: Previously we used a tree set with a timestamp comparator to sort photos prior to uploading to Flickr.  This had a flaw because multiple photos could have the same timestamp -- and because we were using a set, only one of those photos would be included. Bug originally reported at: http://askubuntu.com/questions/42063/shotwell-refusing-to-publish-more-than-one-photo-at-a-time

Message: 3609 "is not set" on text searches changes
Description: When selecting "is not set", the user isno longer offered a text box. More importantly, it's possible to hit OK after setting an "is not set" search.

Message: 3613 - build_alert_body_text() now correctly handles null strings.
3600 - increased the fudge value to prevent crash when user has an image with insane aspect ratios after cropping.
3555 - rewrote the instructions on how to merge events; docs now match what the app does.
3607 synced makefile resources with ui folder
3492 - we now set is_pivotable in the ConstraintDescriptions for these to true.
3601 - fixes a problem where clicks on an already-highlighted sidebar element were getting ignored inappropriately.
3585 tag view has same sort-order as event view

Description: Provides a workaround for the database file read-only check when using an in-memory database.

Message: 3063 - fixed incorrect key combo in mallard files.
Updated pot files after string freeze, updated translations.
3562 "New saved search" option in context menu of empty sidebar area

Description: Fixes use of ngettext in plural strings with no explicit number present.

Message: Removed a duplicate definition argument from the gcc command line.
Put the line that launches the compiler back like I found it.
Added more testcases, wrote a proper int comparator.
This file adds tests for SortedList.
Adding dependency file so Valadate can find and pull in all VAPIs needed
Description: to correctly handle libshotwell.vapi .

Message: Don't attempt to generate libshotwell.deps anymore.
Caused 'src/libshotwell.vapi' to be ignored, since it's generated at compile
Description: time and should not be versioned.
This is needed for automatic tests that can exercise functionality that can throw this error.

Message: Altered configure and Makefile to support automatic testing.
Description: Running 'make check' now tests to see if the user has valadate installed  before continuing with the build. Reworded help in configure to make it more concise.
Should make translation easier.

Message: 3577/3575 resolves crash while entering full screen on a filtered-out item and assertion on single photo mode prev/next

Description: Previously, a mirrored collection respected the ordering of what it was mirroring.  This wasn't necessary and introduced a subtle bug where tags and events were shown out-of-order.

Message: 3557 unique name generated for saved searches
3515 saved search dialog disables OK button until search is valid
Removed duplicate message keys from shotwell.pot; all POT files are now ready.
Phase 3 of the forking of the shotwell translation namespace.
Stage 2 of previously mentioned directory hierarchy restructuring
Restructured po/ directory hierarchy to support a separate shotwell-extras translation domain
This addresses #3482 by allowing more exotic crop aspect ratios.
Description: It also makes Box smarter by allowing it to handle invalid arguments to its constructor gracefully, rather than just exceptioning out.

Message: This fixes #3466 by adding a handler for keypress events on KP_Enter and connecting to it.
3528 keyboard mnemonics in New Search dialog
3530 Delete key on sidebar can remove a saved search

3511 search editing and 3558 search criteria removed when search deleted
3541 Crash while adjusting ratings in single photo view
Description: The single photo view's parent ViewCollection no longer had the photo after changing its rating, so it could not be selected when switching between photos.  Solved by creating a new version of get_view_for_source() that respects view filtering (called get_view_for_source_filtered())

Message: Fixes a crash introduced during the sidebar refactoring. Closes #3531. Introduces additional sidebar safety checks.
Fixes an issue where context-clicking the Trash would cause a segfault. Closes #3507.
3543 moved new search to edit menu
This fixes #3066 by adding support for the ability to change the exposure date of a video file (in the database only, currently).
Removes the GNOME vfs dependency from the Makefile and debian/control file.
Enables elimination of GNOME vfs dependency. Special thanks to Benedikt Sauer.
Fixes an issue in which menu labels failed to update when the name of a tag was changed. Special thanks to Valentin Barros.
Added Valentín Barros to the THANKS file.
Adds tabs to and rearranges the Preferences dialog so that it fits comfortably on netbook screens. Special thanks to Valentín Barros.
3517 boolean search by flagged and rating
Fixes an issue with using internationalized characters in tags. Closes #2612. Special thanks to Marcel Stimberg.
3397: If video file in a container our metadata reader doesn't recognize and the user is copying on import, the file will not be imported.  Fixed by Tobias Rapp.
3514 enter is the same as hitting OK in search box
updated version numbers, news, and changelog following 0.9.3
Preliminary fix for #3532. Will have Vera pull and verify.
Shortened a Russian string that was too long.  Fixes #3495.
Updated import directory (year, month, day) translations.
Changed a string in the Commonwealth English (en_GB) translation that was non-sensical. Closes #3500.
Displays the event name and the event date range only once if they're the same. Closes #3512.
Adds GSettings adapter support to the Config module. Via GSettings, we can now set the desktop background on GNOME 3 systems. Fixes #3496.
Refixed #3501 in the wake of a little git snafu.
Revert "#2987: GnomeVFS dependency eliminated.  Courtesy Jon Dill."
Description: That proposed fix broke video importing from cameras. This reverts commit 5e3535bd8896fb23f75900e1ab04c139c9e10a6e.
(note: my last commit was actually for removing page.get_controller(), not for the plugin warning. sorry for the confusion!)

Message: Properly marks several strings in the preferences dialog for translation. Closes #3497.
The Makefile no longer uses GNU-style defines when invoking m4 macros for compatibility with BSD systems. Closes #3493.
3490 search bar now appears when a rating filter is selected
Potentially fixes bug #3489; Vera will verify if this fix works.
Fixes an issue in which text could get cut off in several dialog panes. Closes #3476.
Properly encodes the ampersand when doing XML decimal entity encoding for GData-based services. Closes #3475.
Fixes a serious build system issue in which the name of the translation file search directory wasn't properly being passed from a Makefile variable to a compiler #define. Closes #3478.
Fixes a bug in which some publishing operations would continue even after the user had cancelled publishing. Closes #3472.
Fixes a critical publishing bug. Closes #3471.
Fixes a serious publishing regression affecting publishing a photo in the single-photo (aka "full window") view. Closes #3470.
This fixes 3457 by making the 'unable to publish' dialog HIG-compliant, and adding a workaround the problem where Gtk.MessageDialog.with_markup() doesn't seem to work.
Made alert dialogs comply with GNOME HIG
Adds the REQUIRED_CFLAGS to the Makefile, which forces the setting of the PIC flag on 64-bit systems.

If CFLAGS was set externally (environment variable, command-line, or in configure.mk) we want to honor those flags.  However, the code to do that also cleared all flags passed to the plugins.  This fixes that problem.
Fixes a quibble one of the Fedora guys mentioned with the way we were naming the system library directory name option in our configure script. Re-closes #3421.
Fixes a regression in which the Flickr publisher wouldn't properly log the user out if the user's session key had expired. Closes #3442.
Following McCann's suggestion for better compliance with GNOME 3 naming standards, shortens the application name in the desktop files for both the manager and viewer.
Taking advantage of the new units in the last commit, I've moved some of the pages into their appropriate units.

Sidebar refactoring.  Large commit, to be sure, but this should make it much easier to manage the sidebar going into the future as well as put the intelligence for managing each branch in a separate compartment, where it belongs.  Other minor bugs were discovered while testing the code, fixed as well.
Allows configuring the name of the system library directory at build time. Closes #3421.
3453: Undated event producing "(null)" in the date range UI field.
Fixes an appearance regression in which the red-eye rectangle was not drawn correctly. Closes #3434.
3436: Compiz packaged with Natty revealed bug in tool window placement code.
3437: Plugins will now build with -O0 with ./configure --debug
This addresses #3371 by using the absolute file and path as source and dest identifier when making the new BatchImportResult, instead of just using the job source and dest.
This fixes #3163 by adding the absolute path to the rejected file to the newly-created BatchImportResult, rather than just the job path.
2987: GnomeVFS dependency eliminated.  Courtesy Jon Dill.
This fixes #3399 by making sure that, when looking for a service, we check that it supports exactly the media we want.

Properly handles account-not-set-up situations in the YouTube connector. Fixes a problem in which the service selector box in the publishing dialog could become permanently locked, preventing service changes. Closes #3398 and #3405.
3352 removed array copy hack needed for vala 0.10
3400 search keyword behavior on event and camera import pages

Created Library unit which represents Shotwell in library mode.  This and the Direct unit greatly simplifies unit initialization, as initializing the respective unit will initialize all their dependencies automatically.
Updating version number for trunk after branch.
A file was added to the help system.
3394 going to full screen accidentally reset the search bar
Took out some Makefile debug code.
prep for 0.9: changes to makefiles, debian package, news
Plugin resource files weren't being added to the tarball.
Removed spaces from valadoc comments that valadoc doesn't like.
3385 issue with toolbar not functioning after changing page and toggling it on
3389: Logging out of Flickr attempted to go through the public start() interface, which was interpreted as a restart, a no-no in the publishing API.  This corrects that.

3388: Adding tags to a lot of photos would hang the system.  Problem lies in signal reflection from DataSources to DataViews of alterations, but "altered" signal handlers should also be examining alterations before processing.  This does the latter.
Noticed that soft assertions were happening with BackgroundJobs in the workers threads.  This was due to a change in Vala 0.11.  This fixes that problem.
3372: Fixed crop problem.  Only occurred when search bar was visible, which causes caching problems.  See also #3381.
added two missing icon files to makefile
Related to #3366, fixed a couple of places that were using the owned keyword where it's unnecessary or ref should be used instead.
This addresses #3162 by moving the custom directory naming blurb from the website to this file.

This fixes #3162 by giving us the ability to manually handle the help link ourselves for non-system-wide help files, and the ability to direct launch_help to try to get us a particular page, if needed.
3366: owned keyword is causing a Pixbuf memory leak w/ 0.11.7.  Fixed.
This addresses #3367 by splitting out the mechanism that gets the current help path into its own method.
3362 fix for video thumbnailing with vala 0.11
3364: Desktop file didn't have the trailing semi on the mime-type list.  Courtesy Michel Alexandre Salim.
3282: Problem linking shotwell-publishing on 64-bit Maverick fixed.
This fixes #3260 by adding the ability to close the search bar from a context menu.
Fixes a fatal error that occurred when attempting to publish to Flickr when no network connection was available. Closes #3361.
3297: Fixed so progress bar appears when library is large enough.
Almost dynamically changes the prelight and active colors of the search bar buttons when the user changes the checkerboard view background color. Closes #3276.
3344 search toolbar buttons are greyed-out instead of disabled
3357 corrected folder for videos during file import
This addresses #3255 by re-selecting the current photograph in switching_from().

This fixes #3321 by altering the way we set the initial value of the radio action group, as well as making sure that the events directory page gets constructed with the proper sort setting (by making it read from the config).
This addresses #3351 by making it so we get a photo's base name (that is, the master filename), rather than just the name (which is the current title) for this dialog.
Fixed #3108 (ubuntu 10.10 ppa shotwell binary deb depends on libraw-dev).
3353 color of message text on checkerboard page
This addresses #3343 by preventing the search bar's text entry field from ever being made insensitive.
Removed Ubuntu-specific version number dependency.  This fixes #3295.
Refines search bar icons; closes #3190 and #3194.
3340 fatal error importing from unreadable directory
3102 for Flickr, sort uploads in reverse chronological order prior to upload
1926: Edit multiple titles at once.  Courtesy Wolfgang Steitz.
3337: Shotwell now builds on 0.10.4 (which becomes the baseline requirement).
Added debug and fatal-warning options to plugins' valac command.
Whoa. That last check-in generated a build warning. Fixed.
3309: The icon cache in the sidebar was broken and growing without bounds.  This was exacerbated by Vera's test set, which has 10,000 photos creating 10,000 events.
Improves plug-in icons. Adds service-specific icons for publishing plugins and defines a generic plugin icon.

This fixes #3290 by 1) adding a new signal in SearchFilterAction to indicate the Criteria has changed 2) connecting to this signal in SearchToolbar and changing the visibility of the appropriate widgets when receiving it.
3288 fixes for direct mode with large folders

Changed SPIT to pass Spit.EntryPointParams struct rather than plain values to allow for future expansion.  This was precipitated by the publishing plugins needed to know their module file early so they can load their icons.  Also updated the simple-plugin, which suffered from bitrot after some earlier interface changes.
3132: When a duplicate file is imported and a match is marked offline, the match will be brought back online pointing to the new file.
3308 search bar was appearing on single photo page when returning from full screen
3202: Additional fix for Yandex.Fotki plugin.  Courtest Evgeniy Polyakov.
3313: Hot keys now routed through Gtk.Actions, so they only activate if the action is sensitive.

3172: Will no longer recompile Vala code when nothing to be done.  Had to do with temporary directory and a hidden timestamp in it, and the compilation files (.c, .o) being generated after the stamp file (making the temporary directory newer than the stamp).
This fixes #3196 by adding a length parameter to prepare_input_string that tells it to truncate an incoming string after this many characters if positive, or do not truncate if negative.
"make clean" was leaving behind some detritus in the plugins directory.  Fixed.
3306: Pluggables may now provide icons at multiple sizes.

3152: Fixes crasher where two different Hirigana tag names collated as equal when they plainly were not.  Also fixes a bug I discovered while investigating that a soft assertion was triggered when pages were destroyed.
3287: Common accelerators now only respond on pages they're supposed to.
3284: Created shotwell-publishing-extras, which holds the Yandex.Fotki connector.
3291: Performance improvements with free-text keyword searching.
Added optional timers to view filtering to measure search.
Makes sure all network transactions are properly stopped when publishing is cancelled. Closes #3296.
3280 #3281 ctrl-a crash in single photo mode, ctrl-shift-a added
3265: Added license to publishing plugins.  Also added authors and cleaned up how common strings are handled in the core plugins code.
Even stupider.  Code just needs to go away.
Fixes bug Eric found where the Flagged toggle was being cleared when switching to and from the full-window view.
Adds valadoc documentation for the publishing interfaces.
3277 escape key for clearing search filter, fixes to make key-press-event signal honor contract
3259: Search bar now dynamically indicates the availability of content on each page and makes those filters insensitive when it's not.
This fixes #3226 by correcting a minor typo in paint_sprockets() - the extra sprocket hole for the straggler pixels was accidentally being drawn on the left twice.
Corrected error in shotwell.pot, updated translations.
3262 removed key lock/unlock system for text entry
Fixed a problem in which a non-ASCII character appeared in a string marked for translation, preventing generation of the POT file.

Some strings marked for translation had been broken apart with the string concatenation ("+") operator. This is not compatible with GNU gettext. This had caused a bad POT file to be generated. These strings were fixed.
Updated shotwell.pot and po files after string freeze. Added Telugu (India) translation.
Latest version of Valadoc in trunk chokes on two spaces after a period (but, ironically, they can be placed anywhere else in the sentence).  Removed the offensive whitespace.

This addresses #3245 by adding the option to replace \r and \n characters in prepare_input_text() with the STRIP_CRLF option, making sure that event renaming properly uses this option, and reaps some unused code from PhotoMetadata.vala as well.
This fixes #3253 by checking whether a publishing service is available to handle the selected type of media, and if none can, instead of throwing an exception, it now sends up a dialog.
Improves messages displayed when view collections are empty or when no items in the collection match the search filter. Closes #3213.
3192: Implicit AND in the search box.  Courtesy Wolfgang Steitz.
3214: Media page is now Library page.
Moved DataObject/DataCollection heirarchy into core unit and split them up into more logical file groupings.
Adds some additional functionality to ViewCollection.
The Facebook login WebKit control now displays the loaded HTML page in the user's system language (if Facebook supports it). Closes #3022.
Appends null pointers to selected string arrays as a workaround for #3264. Closes #3257.
This fixes #3240 by altering the way a date span is pretty printed if the start and end dates are two consecutive days in the same calendar month.
3246 #3247 scrollbar fixed after returning from single image view
Updated to build 0.8.90 prerelease.  Also fixed a bug Vera found where disabling a plugin would cause Shotwell to crash.
3261: Shotwell role (library/direct) and version number now first thing logged.
3241: Search bar is activated (made visible) when the user makes any change to filtering.
3207: Added text labels to search bar.  #3228: Moved the filter toggle buttons to left side of bar while keeping text box to the right.
