3188: Find button added to toolbars on pages that show media (but not pages that show events).  Some other code cleanup too, including moving to a single Gtk.ActionGroup for common actions, meaning that LibraryWindow doesn't have to synchronize actions when pages are switched from (and that pages can monitor those actions for their own state, which cleans up EventDirectoryPage a bit).
This addresses #3212 by not creating or showing the size-chooser widgets if the current media types don't include photographs.
This addresses #3232 by saving the user's size choice to, and restoring it from, gconf.
This fixes 3230 by restoring the ui object for this dialog box (it had gone missing as of 2640, Glade bug suspected)
3185: Selection time on a page would grow each time a page was switched back to.  Fixed.
3250: Progress bar now displayed while printing.  Operation can be cancelled from its Cancel button.

This addresses #3216 by making SuccessPane's constructor take an argument that tells how many media items have been uploaded, and altering the displayed string based on whether that argument is equal to one or not.
Description: When the pane is created and installed, we pass publishables.length, which should tell us how many media items the user was trying to publish.

Message: Fixes a problem in which publishing to Picasa Web Albums and YouTube would fail if a media item's title contained non-ASCII characters. Closes #3081.
Fixes two regressions introduced when the Flickr and Facebook connectors were ported from the legacy publishing API to the new pluggable publishing API. Closes #3171 and #3252.

3233: Fixes crasher caused by marking a photo Rejected and then back to Unrated while in full-window mode.  This cleans up some of the bookkeeping in ViewCollection with how hidden items are dealt with when they're selected as well.

This addresses #3016 by checking whether any of the media items in an event have altered exposure times (as opposed to the alteration type "metadata, time" which is valid for whole events, but not individual images or videos).  If one or more media items has an exposure time change, the entire event is marked as 'dirty' so the sidebar will know to re-examine the fields and refresh them.
Description: In addition, if the event doesn't yet have user-assigned name, a "metadata, name" alteration is sent up, since the name displayed for the event will need to change from 'Event XXXX' to the start date of the event.

Message: 3248: Fixes critical assertion when null string is passed to guarded_markup_escape_text().
1188: Print multiple photos per page in various layouts.  #3159: Print multiple photos on successive pages.  Both courtesy Nikola Radovanovic.
Migrates the YouTube connector to the new pluggable, publishing API.
3225: Thought I made these string changes in a prior commit but did not.

This addresses #3218 by changing how the user input is prepared and sanitized so that we accept empty strings.  This makes renaming an event to "" in the dialog box function exactly the same as it does in the sidebar.
Moved Clinton to top section of THANKS file.
Valadoc-ed the SPIT and transitions interfaces and added a docs target in the Makefile to generate Valadoc for Shotwell's plugin API.
3215: The search bar's background is now dynamically updated as the user changes the background color in the Preferences dialog.
Ports the Flickr connector to new pluggable publishing API. Closes #3200.
3044: Now writing metadata to all 3 domains on an update.
This fixes 3124; we now use the GConf system to remember whether the user had the find bar hidden or shown, and on start up, we set it to this.

3211: Brought back View -> Filter Photos, which is now available whenever the search bar is available.  #3225: Adjusted the search filter tooltips.  Reworked search filter to split out the Gtk.Actions (which are then shared among all pages).
This addresses #3124; it's copied and pasted from the original fix (see r2615)
Make the toolbar button background color match the toolbar background.
Description: This partially fixes http://trac.yorba.org/ticket/3215 .

Message: 3188: Added back Ctrl+F to set cursor focus to the text entry box in the search bar.  This patch also allows the search bar to be hidden and available through View -> Search Bar.
This fixes 2916 by doing the following:
Description: 1. Adds an enum with values for the standard (720 px) and large (2048 px) picture sizes.    2. Adds support to the various publishing-related methods (do_upload(), on_publishing_options_pane_publish(), etc) for a third parameter telling us what resolution the user chose.    3. Adds a combobox to the legacy options pane in which the user may choose their desired resolution, along with a label and any ancillary layout stuff.

Message: 2229: Event name is now a date range for events spanning multiple days.  #2599: If an event is named, the date (or date range) appears in its tooltip along with its name.  Both courtesy Wolfgang Steitz.
3170: Plugins can now be enabled/disabled via the Preferences dialog.
This fixes 3175 by checking whether we're making a new gallery or uploading a video. If neither is true, we set the combo box to insensitive.
Ports the Picasa publishing client to the new pluggable publishing API. Services discovered dynamically now automatically have their names placed in the service selector box.
Fixed #3208 (toolbar items shift when rating filter changes).
3157: Use more processors (when available) for generating mimics.
This addresses ticket #3004 by checking to see whether we're getting a close or delete event back from the dialog box.  If so, we treat this as cancel and stay on the current photo,
Description: since the user didn't yet decide whether to keep or revert their edits.

Message: Updated copyright to 2011 in PO files. Updated English (UK), Finnish, Hebrew, Hungarian, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, and Turkish translations.
182: Further work on plugins.  Added reserved symbols to plugin interfaces to make room for future expansion.
3143: New data model for direct-edit mode to fix navigation problem.
2611 prevent sidebar scrolling when deleting tags and events
This addresses ticker #853 - holding down ctrl+shift while clicking to choose items works like it does in Nautilus file manager.
Simplified names in the publishing API; fixed a problem with Facebook logout that should've been in my previous commit but wasn't. ;-)
Simplifies and refines the new publishing API; at this point, the API is "stable" but not yet "frozen".
This fixes #3146 by slightly increasing the size of the 'dirty' region when preparing to erase the clip box from the previous frame.
Fix for #3144 - this adds the ability to press Ctrl-F in any area of the app that has the search box to send focus to it.
Fix for #3023; we now check whether a failed external edit file creation is due to insufficient permissions, and if so, display a friendlier error message.
Removed spitter plugin, as it was only intended to test out early implementations of the plugin loader.  samples/simple-plugin is a better place for what spitter set out to achieve.

3160: Plugin headers and VAPI files are now installable.  Must be enabled with the configure script.  A .pc file is also installed.  #2535: Now that all valac warnings have been eliminated and we require Vala 0.10.0 or above, added --fatal-warnings option to Makefile.  #3167: Fixed "unreachable catch clause" build warning.  Also added sample plugin to source tree.
3129 fixed segfault when opening photo with missing backing file
3059 jump to last import page after import
Fix for #3124. We now track whether we've gotten an event for the escape key, and if so, we clear the search box, otherwise, we let the event proceed normally.

The Facebook Connector, previously ported to the new publishing API, has now been packaged in a separate .so file as a dynamically loadable plug-in. This is the result of both code and build system changes.
Build system now removes temp file leftover during VAPI creation.
3121: Fixed critical warning in progress bar.  Needed to wait for realize signal (which means the GDK window object has been created) before calling methods on the GDK window.
Dialogs: made the Preferences dialog regain focus if the user chooses 'Edit -> Preferences' a second time (trac #3001)
Description: PiwigoConnector: changed the mnemonic for the 'Username' field from 'U' to 'N' (#3002)

Message: 2450: Toolbar now remains pinned in fullscreen mode.  Courtesy Philip Beam.

Refines the new publishing API so that the plugin host completely encapsulates operations on temporary files. This way, plugin writers don't have to deal with temporaries. Changed the reference Facebook plugin to conform to the changed API.
601: Import TIFF files.  This represents basic TIFF support, 8-bit pipeline only, using gdk-pixbuf as the support library.
3148: Moved AlienDb/F-Spot import menu actions into LibraryWindow as a common action.
3096: Unitize the alien database/F-Spot import code.  Courtesy Bruno Girin.
Ports the Facebook connector to the new publishing API. Includes refinements to the publishing API to support the ported Facebook connector as well as the soon-to-be-ported Picasa connector.
2705: Maximum Vala compiler version now checked during build.
2519: Migration from DBus GLib to GDBus.
3142: Fixes segfault if a transition is occurring when the window is destroyed.
2527: Cairo now used for all drawing.  Courtesy Siddhesh Poyarekar.
3114: mkunit and Makefile now handle subunits properly.  Courtesy Bruno Girin.
2869: Delete tag with the Delete button.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
2987: Now using VFS to retrieve file's mime-type to verify it's a video rather than a hard-coded list of extensions.  Courtesy Bruno Girin.
Fixed #3127 (Shotwell fails to build on trunk), replacing a non-portable
Description: echo command with printf.
Fixed #3113 (Original date displayed as 01/m/2011 in adjust date and time dialog).

Message: 182: Further work on the plugins interface.  First live implementation of Shotwell plugins included in this commit: Slideshow transitions.
1081: Slideshow transitions, including Fade, Shift, and Tear down.  Courtesy Maxim Kartashev.
182: Further work in building infrastructure to support plug-ins.
This commits the "chilled" version of the Publishing Plugins API that will be used to develop the first reference plugin.
3097: Fixes problem in sidebar where renaming one event renames a second.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
182: First step toward publishing plugins.  This establishes the plugins unit and makes first-stab declarations toward interfaces that will be used in the publishing process.

2650: Major reorganization of Shotwell source into units, which puts code of related or similar functionality into logical groupings.  Code is now "unitized" or "ununitized".  Four new units are introduced here (unit, util, db, and threads).  More will follow, so that the reorg is in small stages and not one fell swoop.
2846 #2647 view collection now copied when entering single photo mode
2490: Renaming event or tag now sticks when Enter or clicked away.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
Updated version numbers of the Makefile, POT file, and all PO files to 0.8.1+trunk following the Shotwell 0.8.1 release.
Merged the debian/changelog file from the 0.8.x branch into trunk following the release of Shotwell 0.8.1.
Merged NEWS file from the 0.8.x release branch following the relase of Shotwell 0.8.1.
2979 specific error when unable to import to library folder
2874: Only show the progress dialog box after a small amount of time has elapsed, to prevent it flashing on the screen for quick operations.  Courtesy Maxim.
3076: ImportPage wasn't deleting videos if the user requested it.
3075: Add/Modify Tags was missing in Videos context menu.  Courtesty Richard B. Kreckel.
3020: Fixes a situation where an invalid tag name (blank or all spaces) makes it way into the database and then can't be added to a tag lookup table at startup.
3014: Similar to #3033, but this deals not with an empty keyword list but when the keyword list is nothing but spaces.
3057: Fixes problem reading video metadata from certain MP4/Quicktime files.
Updated Italian and Portuguese translations in 0.8 branch.
3056: Added support for the Samsung RAW format (.srw)
3033: Importing a file with an empty keyword list in its metadata caused Shotwell to segfault.
3030: 3GP support (originally added to trunk in r2529) merged into 0.8 branch.
3050: Fixes build error with Vala 0.10.2.  Also discovered during testing that we no longer build on Vala 0.9.7 (our stated minimum version).  We now require 0.9.8.
Oops!  Never committed necessary changes to packaging 0.8.  Here they are.
Added .3gp and .3g2 to the list of video file extensions.
2310 date comparison will compare against filenames when dates are equal
2905 strip extra bytes off end of GPhoto thumbnails
Updated Hungarian, Swedish, and Turkish translations in shotwell-0.8 branch.
Langtouched po files to version shotwell-0.8.0 in branch.
3010: Fixed warnings in full-window mode (usually only appear when a file is missing).
The Makefile that Mallard should have supplied.
Fixed a mistake in the Print help page.
2998: Solves memory leak problem without causing problem discovered in #3006.
Backed out r2509 since it broke importing.
2998: Solves memory leak when importing photos.
3000 can now select pre-selected library folder
2988 and #2502: When keywords are altered in the master or editable file, now replacing Shotwell tags with those in the file.  Lucas did prelim on this ticket.
A warning that was leftover from r2504.

A user sent me a file that Shotwell would not import.  It turns out BatchImport was not handling the error case of a file with unreadable metadata (which can happen with RAW files) properly, treating it as a hard error.  This fixes that problem.
2969: Auto-import was not detecting content duplicates and importing them.  BatchImport would then detect the MD5 duplicate and untrash the matching file.  This fixes that.
2994: Fixed regression with handling fullscreen mode with photos and videos present.
2990 and #2991: Nasty, nasty memory leak caused by three bugs working in concert to keep the HTTP payload (worse case, an entire video file) in memory.
3003: The command (undo/redo) stack is reset when a new file is loaded into the photo viewer (saving a photo entails a re-load, so it works for this as well).
Recent change to handle fullscreen mode didn't take into account how the ImportPage guards against fullscreen mode.  Shouldn't error out, returning null is the proper way.
2994: Fixed how Fullscreen mode works, both in verifying that only a photo may be the source of fullscreen mode and the Gtk.Action's sensitivity.
This fixes a crasher I found over the weekend where DirectoryMonitor would assert if a directory was created and renamed or deleted before the monitor was notified of the creation.
2893 #2587 use full image for batch import dupe detection, thread issue in file import
2982: Video duplicates now detected on camera import page.
2986: WMV video support.  Courtesy Jani Monoses.
First batch of documentation updates for 0.8.
Assertions unnecessary and are triggered when importing video.
2984: MetadataWriter now knows when photos added to the LibraryPhotoSourceCollection are coming in due to an import, and will not see if they need to be updated.
2952: Now displaying Korean text properly.  Using composed Unicode within Shotwell for user text now.

Found a problem similar to one Eric encountered in LibraryPhotoSourceCollection, which is that it's possible for duplicate files (with same MD5) to be tombstoned, causing problems with an internal lookup map.
2307: Symbolic links now fully supported in library monitoring and auto-import.  Symlinks still not supported in user-initiated import.
Fixes #2971. Special thanks to marcel for the submitting this patch!
2975 left/right buttons appear correctly in direct mode
2487: Modified photos no longer imported as separate photos.
2974: Lucas suggested a HashSet makes more sense here.

Some reworking of MetadataWriter to make it less intrusive in the system and to fix some of its bugs.  There is also auxilliary work here to make some of the commands more responsive.  #2976: No more assertion when undoing a move to trash while MetadataWriter was at work.  #2941 and #2978: MetadataWriter's progress bar is more consistent now.  #2974: Renamed tags are now written out to master files.
2773: Fixed this problem by using gexiv2_get_tag_multiple(), which returns an array of strings for a particular value.  We're simply using the first one for the title and description.
2830: When library directory is changed, a new LibrayMonitor object is installed and the old one is closed.
Updated all translations to include new Flickr sizes.
2896: Current photo being imported is now logged.
2953: Fixed navigation in full-window mode to skip (rather than stop) at videos in controller collection.
Fixed a bug introduced in r2458 where there's a need to search a SortedList for an item whose underlying state has changed and is no longer in sorted order.
2907: Auto-import no longer starts on photos imported via a camera.
2936: Fixed flag/unflag option going out of sync in full-window mode.
2935: Tag assertion fixed.  Images that were being imported had UTF-8 issues and weren't being normalized.
Updated shotwell.pot with new Flickr upload sizes.
Changed searches in two locations to binary search, which makes a noticeable difference with large collections (even simple operations, like clicking on a photo toward the bottom of the Photos page).
2956: Fixed database assertion when upgrading from 0.7.2.  Hopefully using this new method, we won't be bitten by this going forward.
Added 2 new resolutions for Flickr publishing.
Updated Russian translation to display 24-hour time.
2950: Improper ViewCollection filtering caused mass confusion when items destined to be hidden were added.
Further tweaks I found after the changes I made this morning.
Change to TRACE_MONITORING message to make it easier to track notifications.
2927 resolved some assertion issues when removing photos
2873 duplicate photo now adds itself to the event and tags
2924: Duplicates detected during auto-import are now tombstoned so they are not auto-imported later.  Also various changes to make the system more reponsive during the startup scan.
2069 show file path on import failed

2691: Runtime monitoring and auto-import for videos added.  This patch separates concerns as far as the two's requirements for monitoring as well as maximizes common code between them.  ##2663: Tombstoning of videos now enabled.
Darkens the flag icon colors as per Adam's request. Closes #2930.
Correct format error in Slovenian translation.
Now the complete POT file. Corrected format errors in Czech, German, Hebrew translations.

Added Macedonian translation. Updated Chinese (Taiwan), Croatian, Czech, Danish, Estonian, Finnish, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hungarian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Russian, Serbian, Spanish translations.
2871 #2917 event photos were being mangled in database
Corrected format error in Italian translation.

2922: Fixed problem with two Tags menus appearing on Tag page.  Event page had the same problem with the Events menu; fixed as well.  Finally, at some point the "Remove Photo From Tag 'Foo'" was dropped from the Tag page context menu.  I've re-added it.
Fixes a crasher I found when the sort value in GConf is monkeyed with.
2755: Removed Slideshow button from CollectionPage.  #2768: Removed Play icon from Slideshow action, as we're using it for Play Video now.
Properly displays the new flagged icon on the PhotoPage. Closes #2926.
Fixes several regressions in the Properties class introduced through the refactoring of the Source and Import hierarchies to support video. Closes #2904 and #2803.
Adds a flagged trinket icon as well as a page icon for the Flagged page. Closes #2809.
Added a missing backslash in the Makefile.
2069 list duplicates in camera import dialog

2625: Fixes the thumbnails jumping around when scrolling.  Was able to repro this and see it had to do when tags and/or titles were displayed.  Also, minor fixes elsewhere in the code I detected over the weekend, including a slight change to BatchImport to improve performance when a lot of duplicates are detected.
Updated COPYING to include license information for gnome-icon-theme
Description: since we've just borrowed an icon from it.

Message: A Makefile fix from Norbert Preining link.
Adds an icon to the Videos sidebar entry; updates the non-interpretable badge image to match; closes #2571.
1184 photo dates can now come from DateTimeDigitized and DateTime tags
Closes #2695, #2736, #2762 and fixes a previously unreported critical GLib cast warning.
Fixed #2464 (improve icon in title bar, Applications menu, Alt+Tab menu).
2837 and #2890 Added AVI support, fixed bug in QuickTime detection
Moved Eric upward in THANKS file.  Thanks, Eric!

2560: Solves crash when importing due to UTF-8 representation differences.  Need to be more thorough in code to validate and normalize all text originating from outside the system -- user input, metadata, and so forth.
2799: Fixes the ordering of the toplevel items in the sidebar.  Now using an ordinal (an enum) to sort the toplevel items, so adding new ones should not be so troublesome in the future.
2888: Remove From Library now in MediaPage (therefore available in VideosPage).
2884: Added Send To... to context menus.
Updated Chinese (Taiwan), Croatian, English (UK), Estonian, German, Hebrew, Galician, Polish, Portuguese, Portuguese (Brazil), Romanian, Russian, Serbian, Slovenian, Turkish translations.
Draws sprocket holes as a differentiating visual indicator on video thumbnails. Closes #2575.

Video thumbnails are now generated from the frame whose timepoint is 1/3 of the video's duration. This eliminates a problem where many video thumbnails would appear black because of fade-in effects. Closes #2568.
This fixes a thrown exception I saw while importing a particular video.  It appears InputStream.skip() has problems with large values that are within its count type's range.
Updated Basque, Chinese (Mainland PRC), Dutch, French, Galician, Hebrew, Italian, Kazakh, Korean, Portuguese (Brazil), Russian, Serbian, Slovenian, Spanish, and Ukrainian translations.
2817: Directory monitor assertion failure with library over SSH.  The problem only occurred when the library directory was set to an SSH directory.
Generated new POT file following string freeze.
2624 take care of error cases when moving to desktop trash
2864: Separate race condition discovered that was exacerbated on duo-core machines.
Patch from Evgeniy Polyakov to change OAuth parsing in YandexConnector.
1296: Correcting problem with display time on desktop slideshow dialog consistently.

2566: Re-committed import memory leak fix with the addition that it corrects a tread starvation race condition.  Also during testing I discovered a data structure in LibraryMonitor not being locked although it was used by a thread-safe function.  This patch also corrects that.  In essence, this patch is a replacement for r2371 and r2374 with code fixes.
2837 removed libquicktime and added our own parsing for creation time
2837 removed libquicktime and added our own parsing for creation time
Updates the Last Import page to be compatible with videos and multiple monitoring. Closes #2816, #2823, and #2855.
Adds better error handling throughout the publishing subsystem; closes #2386.
2733: Moved Page Setup into the Print dialog.  Courtesy Till Kamppeter.  Also, forgot to add Glade file for #1296.
1296: Rotate desktop background now available when more than one photo is selected.  Courtesy Maxim.
Disables plugins when instantiating WebKit; closes #2183.
Updated Estonian, Italian, and Portuguese translations.
Backed out changesets 2371 and 2374.  2374 broke importing, and the comments in changeset 2374
Description: implied that 2371 was broken without it, so I've backed out 2371 as well.  Jim can look at this when he's in tomorrow.

Message: Recent patch for importing caused bug where events were not properly generated.

Makes certain highly-visible strings media-specific (e.g., they now report "photos" when operating on photos, "videos" when operating on videos, or "photos/videos" when operating on mixed collections). Closes #2692.

2566: Reworking of BatchImport to keep the background threads busy but never allow their queues to fill up.  The memory leak was actually all the Pixbufs (thumbnails) that were being held in the queue waiting for processing.
2784: Adjust Date/Time dialog checks and grays out "Modify original file" if autocommit metadata is enabled.  Courtesy wolfer.
added slash as a shortcut for flagging images #2810
events and tags menus are now ordered consistently #2631
rotation can now be performed by either ctrl-r and ctrl-shift-r, or via the bracket keys #2700
2750: Enter to return from full-window to checkerboard.  Courtesy wolfer.
larger and more re-sizable title and tag name editor #2727
Implements a new export model that supports mixed exporting of photos, videos, and original RAW files. Closes #2621.
2811: Fixed crash due to trying to scale pixbufs to -1.
2796: Initial cut of VideoMetadata using libquicktime.  A more thorough and robust video metadata library would certainly improve our support, but this is good for now.

2492: Auto-import and auto-commit metadata only take affect once the Preferences dialog has been closed.  Also, changed two chatty directory monitoring logging messages to only appear when TRACE_MONITORING is enabled, and fixed a bug in FlaggedPage dropping thumbnails when they'd had their metadata committed in the background.
2788: Store orientation in photo files when metadata auto-commit is enabled.
2492: When auto-import and auto-commit metadata is selected in Preferences dialog, operations will begin almost immediately.
Updated Catalan, Chinese (Mainland China), Chinese (Taiwan), Estonian, Hebrew, and Japanese translations.
2492: Preferences checkboxes for auto-import and auto-commit metadata.
Minor cleanup: Placed all the command-line options into their own namespace.
2769: Slideshow delay box is now internationalized, and simplified greatly by using a Gtk.SpinButton.  Courtesy Marcel Stimberg.
2770: YouTube and PicasaWeb connectors remember user name if auth token expires.
1988: Facebook privacy control added.  #2752: Last bit of Facebook video uploading merged.  Both courtesy Jani Monoses.
2752: Facebook video upload support.  This and prior commit (Flickr video support) courtesty Jani Monoses.

1110: Send pictures via Nautilus Send To integration.  #2248: Added View Event for Photo to the full-window page context menu.  #2735: Better temporary file management.  Now using /tmp and relying on the system to manage the files (i.e. delete them at boot time).  This change affects all users of temp files, the largest of which right now are the WebConnectors and Send To.
2765: Selecting both photos and videos will offer only services that support both media types.
2764: Publish button now works for videos.
Enables seamless integration of photos and videos in tags and events. Closes #2573.

2030: Progress bar now updated as mimic manager generates mimics.  Also implemented a priority system so the various background tasks can share the progress bar.  (Worth discussing what the priorities should be.)

374: Real-time library monitoring.  Currently only available through command-line options --runtime-monitoring and --runtime-import.  Still testing to be done for scalability issues, but this represents the fundamental architecture.
Fixes bug reported by Милош Поповић.  Assertion was incorrect; it's possible for files to be removed from DirectoryMonitor during discovery.  This catches it and marks the photo as offline.
2694: Video files located outside of library directory are no longer marked offline without verifying existance.
2751: YouTube connector now handles 401 error.  Courtesy Jani Monoses.
This adds schema version numbers to the warning dialog when attempting to use Shotwell on a newer database.  This could help with debugging problems.
This fixes a soft assertion that appears when an issue with the database is detected at startup.
2724: Remember last album in Picasa Web connector.  Courtesy Jani Monoses.
Updated no-c-format designation in pot file and affected translations.
Added Basque translation, updated German translation.
2710: segfaults due to bad generated .c (calling a static method through an instance variable).
Added the user_photos permissions flag to the Facebook permissions request. This may fix #2370.
2698: Improved Preferences dialog.  Courtesy Louis-Francis Ratté-Boulianne.
2536: Yandex.Fotki Web service support.  Courtesy Evgeniy Polyakov.
Cleaned up Thumbnail's implementation to take advantage of MediaSource's genericities.
This takes some ideas added to MediaSource and genericizes them to all DataSources.  This simplifies persisting DataSources outside of the database, such as in the thumbnail cache and backlinks.
Added Transifex token to verify new repository location.
Updated Czech, Korean, Japanese, Norwegian, and Spanish translations.

2666: Mark photo as dirty whenever the appropriate metadata is updated, even if autocommit-metadata is disabled.  This persists the dirty flag at all times, meaning if it is enabled MetadataWriter will commit all changes to the backing files.
ViewCollection now supports multiple source monitors.  This is made necessary for video support.
2658: Escape closes Extended Information window.  Courtesy mcben.
2566: Not technically a memory leak, but pixbufs being stacked up in a queue during a disk import due.  Implemented a hysteresis algorithm on the queue to relieve the backlog if it grows too fast.

Further refactors and stablizes video and data collection systems. Enables videos to be marked offline and placed in the trash can. Detects the installation of new system CODECs and tries to update video thumbnails accordingly.
2654: Use Shift+Delete for Remove From Library.  Courtest mcbenn.
Closes #2656. Based on a patch submitted by Jani Monosones. Credited Jani in the THANKS file.
2643: Fixed issue with photos displaying in a single column.
1849: Removed FixedKeyFile.vapi and gdk-none.vapi, both binding patches that were fixed a while back.
Cade changes in preparation for 0.11 (but these do not require 0.11 to compile).  0.11 features better code analysis, which is what it's warning about here.
2287: No more 64-bit printf modifiers.  Courtesy mcben.

1560: Switched to using Gtk.Actions entirely in our Page code.  I've also restructured how Actions are registered with the UI Manager to deal better with multi-tiered class heirarchies (with MediaPage, we now have three-deep Page classes with Actions that must be registered).  I've also made it easier to update the Actions when ViewCollection state changes and pushed more common Action code (i.e. Undo/Redo) into LibraryWindow.
Introduces the new MediaPage class that treats photos and videos uniformly. As a consequence, allows editing titles and setting ratings for videos. Closes #2584.
2475: Now adding Software version to metadata when exporting and writing to master file.
Fixed regression in DataSource's signal reflection to DataView.  This fixes #2598, #2597, and #2595.Also updated strings for #2591 and #2610.
Fixes a bug in last commit -- app won't close if no metadata was auto-committed.
1290: Store tags and other metadata (title/caption, rating, exposure date/time) in photo files
Copied translation updates from 0.7 branch to trunk.
Copied translation update from 0.7 branch to trunk.
Copied translation update from 0.7 branch to trunk.
Copied translation update from 0.7 branch to trunk.
Enables Shotwell to import video files from cameras or the filesystem and play them back in the system-defined media player. Closes #855.
Copied translation updates from 0.7 branch to trunk.
2537: Checking for null refs before calling is_page_selected().
2563: Startup scan no longer reimports if file is merely touched.
Copied translation updates from 0.7 branch to trunk.
2526: A null reference was not handled properly, causing this problem.
Copied German and Korean translations from branch to trunk.
Updated German and Korean translations in 0.7 branch.
Copied Slovak translation from branch to trunk.
Copied po files from 0.7 branch to trunk.

Updated Bulgarian, Catalan, Chinese (Taiwan), Danish, Dutch, Finnish, French, Hungarian, Italian, Japanese, Kazakh, Korean, Spanish, Thai, and Ukrainian translations. Updated shotwell.pot (pulled from trunk version which includes 'Import All' and 'Import Selected').
Fixes two debug messages only logged when TRACE_MD5 is set in the configure script.

2532: If Shotwell can't create vital data files/directories at startup, instead of logging an error and exiting, it displays a dialog box error and exits.  NOTE: This introduces new translatable strings that are not the .pot file.  Although past string freeze, we feel these are very rare cases and won't be seen by 99.9% of users, but should be visible to that one-tenth of a percent that have done something really odd with their permissions.
Fixes sidebar color when running under dark themes. Closes #2483.
2488: Shotwell will only ask user to copy or link on file import if any of the files or directories are outside the library.  If they're all in the library, we always link.

2528: libraw-config tries to find thread-safe version of libraw package file (.pc), which is called libraw_r.pc on Gentoo, before falling back to libraw.pc (which is what I expect other packages to use when this is widespread), then going to the manual step.
Description: This will be a heckuva lot easier when libraw is properly packaged. Patch courtesy Valentin David.

Message: Properly encodes the '+' character during the Picasa login transaction. Closes #2533.
Fix I noticed while working on 0.8 that has been reported by 0.7.1 user.  Backported for inclusion in 0.7.2.
Backmerged change to trunk to 0.7.1+branch for #2523.
Adds null guards in PublishingDialog.go( ). Closes #2523.
2516: File monitor wasn't being created when externally editing a previously-edited file.
2520: Removed all references to deprecated string.len() method.
2524: apport hook now distributed with tar ball.

2515: When the root of the library directory was a symbolic link, DirectoryMonitor would fail to search (not following symbolic links) and so all photos in the library would be marked offline.  Then the offline files were searched to see if they were online individually, which they all were, and so they were marked online.  This solves the problem by following symbolic links only in the directory scan.  More thorough symbolic link support needs to happen.
2510: This limits the number of directories that are traversed at any one time to five.
Updated Catalan, Chinese (Taiwan), French, and Italian translations.
2504: VALAC makefile variable not used when detecting compiler version number.  Courtesy Elliot S.

2478: Files now added (auto-imported) when discovered at startup (use --auto-import command-line option until #2492 is implemented).  #2491: Now have an update bar for background operations.  More work may need to be done if this is used by multiple background operations at the same time.  Note that this patch does NOT address symbolic links, which is ticketed at #2307.
Added GNOME Gettext domain tags to desktop template files following Canonical's changes in response to Launchpad bug #616856.
2484: added keyboard accelerator to Edit menu in DirectPhotoPage
Updated Bulgarian, Chinese (Taiwan), and Japanese translations.
2495: Four strings in ImportPage were not marked for translation.  Fix and Finnish translations courtesy Mikko Huhtala.

2476: At startup (discovery) Shotwell will now notice if a photo's been modified externally and update state, including regen'ing thumbnails, importing new metadata, and discarding transformations.  There's also work done to speed up marking files online/offline.
2248: Jump to event for selected photo.
DataObjects no longer have an "altered" signal.  All "altered" signals come off their SourceCollection, which means it's easier to aggregate and issue them in a single signal.
Updated Makefile given recent Mallard doc changes.
Updated version numbers, NEWS and debian/changelog file to prepare for 0.7.1 release.

2479: Although the same symptoms as the original report of the ticket, it was manifesting itself in a very different way.  This solves the problem of unlocking the ViewCollection before its destroyed.
Added Mallard documentation fixes from Phil Bull along with various further edits.
Added Kazakh translation, updated Estonian, Hungarian, and Japanese translations.
Merged updated translations from trunk to 0.7 branch.
Updated Czech, Galician, Hungarian, Portugese translations.
2479: Fixed crash when removing last photo from an event in full-window page.
2463: added context menu to missing photo page
2465: F-Spot import skipped files imported from F-Spot 0.4.3.1 (and perhaps later) because it did not have a photo_versions table.  This corrects that problem.  Courtesy Bruno Girin.
Re-versioned PO files to have version number 0.7.0+trunk.
Updated Chinese (Taiwan), Italian, Japanese, Hungarian, Portuguese, Russian, and Spanish translations.
Merged changes from branches/shotwell-0.7 to trunk.
Changed the gexiv2 dependency version in the Makefile to agree with the debian/control file.
Prepared the debian and base directories for packaging Shotwell 0.7.
Branch for preparing the Shotwell 0.7 release image.
Fixes a bug Vera found where Revert to Original wasn't working after editing externally.
2449: Full-window page was using wrong dimensions when displaying master (original) image.
2395: increased signals emitted after external edit to fix bug with reverting external edits
Moving help documents from ./help to ./help/C broke loading help when running from build directory.  This fixes it.  See #2451.
Moves Mallard docs to help/C directory. Closes #2438.
2428: removed LibSoup code from PublishingDialog constructor. The code was spinning the event loop and opening the possibility for multiple PublishingDialog windows being created.
2433: Still faster than before, but now more responsive throughout the operation.
2431: Memory leak was due to the Thumbnail exposure flag being initialized to the wrong value, leading every Thumbnail to load its thumbnail, thrashing on the cache.
Changes the way ImportIDs are generated for F-Spot import operations thereby ensuring that F-Spot imports properly appear on the Last Import Page. Closes #2355.
2322: Stops renaming the Tags sidebar item when the locus is on it.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
2422: Patch to make Shotwell more responsive while marking photos offline/online, as well as do the operation quicker than before.
This is an evaluation check-in to determine how memebers of the Shotwell team feel about moving the ratings icon flush-right in the toolbar.
Desaturated and darkened event icon. Closes #2405.
Fixed a problem with installing help, courtesy Jürg Billeter.
2440: Fixes jarring behavior when navigating full-window with missing backing files.
Last import page is now properly shown/hidden depending on import roll state. Closes #2312.
Fixed a bug in how ImportIDs were being stored in memory.  This may affect #2355.
Renamed documentation pages in Makefile: I had changed these in an earlier
Description: commit but forgot to update the Makefile.

Message: Updated POT file to include "User Manual" string.
Added translations for "User Manual" to po files.
Slots in new custom icons as well as stock icons as per the work of an outside contributor. Closes #2435.
2427: grouped zoom slider and icons together so they disappear at the same time
2418: Added User Manual to Help menu.
Added Peter Smith's latest Mallard documentation changes along with some minor edits of my own.
Fixes Welcome dialog import behavior such that photos imported during F-Spot import are no longer reported as duplicates during the follow-on XDG pictures directory import. Closes #2379.
2409: added duplicate detection to trash for files copied into the library
2433: Sped up time to rate multiple photos.
1143: First cut of Mallard documentation, courtesy Robert Ancell and Peter DO Smith.
1334: Autocompletion for tags dialogs.  Courtesy Marcel Stimberg.
An edge case I discovered where the sensitivity of Select All wasn't being updated properly.
2410: fixed bug in which shotwell exported tags when there were nono on a photo
2407: Fixed assertion when moving from full-window page back to originating page (which happened when the single-click on the sidebar caused the element to be edited).
2350: F-Spot import now available throughout application, courtesy Bruno Girin.
Makes the All Photos and All+Rejected ratings filter icons fixed-size PNGs to improve their appearnace. Closes #2415.
Updated Danish, Japanese, and Portuguese translations.
2308: Now marking photos missing on the fly (when they double-click on it).
2404: Date displayed when event name is deleted, even after restart.
2383: "No photos imported" now reported if no photos were imported from F-Spot.  Courtesy Bruno Girin.
The Shotwell icon is now properly displayed next to the "Photos" sidebar entry. Closes #2403.
2392: enabled importing, exporting, and setting library directory with network shares
2360: removed  from numeric accelerators due to conflicts with non-english keyboard layouts
Cancels the overall printing operation when a photo fails to print due its backing file being missing. Closes #2376.
This is the Shotwell 0.6.91 release image.
2408: Critical assertion after edit and save in external editor fixed.
Updated Makefile such that the new sidebar and zoom slider end icons are included in the distribution.
1614: added icons to the ends of the zoom slider
Addresses the issues in #2357, without solving it. Makes the All Photas and All + Rejected icons slightly larger
Addresses the issues in #2357, without solving it. Makes the All Photas and All + Rejected icons slightly larger
2377: Further work to speed up startup.  Now only marking photos online/offline, no attempt to reimport or discover renames.  Huge speed increase in unlinking/relinking tags and events.
2346: F-Spot import dialog now is cancellable if F-Spot database is not present.
Update to visibility interface in ViewCollection.
Fixes a critical bug in which Shotwell would crash when the user attempted to publish a photo whose backing file was missing. Closes #2254.
2374: added tooltips to rating filter button

2319: Improved detection of RAW duplicates on camera when thumbnail is not present by comparing filesize and basename in library.  This prevents copying the (large) file off the camera only to match it via MD5 once it's on local disk.
2377: Startup scan of library directory was taking too long when a large number of files were present that weren't imported into the database.  This fix reduces the time to process these files.
2185: fixed a PhotoPage navigation bug, and introduced changes to the ViewCollection data structure
2335: F-Spot import now available from welcome dialog.
2348: Slideshow now available in full-window mode.
2343: Crash after fullscreen red eye reduction fixed.
2373: Print no longer crashes if the backing file is missing.
Removed c-format comment from strings containing '% ' in POT and PO files.
Additional optimizations ... plenty more work to be done in this area, however.
2371: valac 0.9.5 knows that error() will not return and so no need to provide fake return values for code correctness.  This patch makes Shotwell unable to compile with earlier compilers.
Added Korean translation. Updated Catalan, Danish, Estonian, Italian, Japanese, Lithuanian, and Romanian translations.
Further optimizations and code refactoring to help speed up startup time and trash/offline moves.
Further optimizations in startup time.  Almost all pages (the Photos page is the lone hold-out) are stubs, the pages themselves created as they're accessed.  This has big wins on startup time.
2354: fixed set rating display bug when photo is missing
Updated Galician, Polish, and Swedish translations.

2302: On startup, now checking all photos at startup for online/offline status, including those outside the library directory.  This patch also includes various optimizations in linking/unlinking and freezing/thawing DataCollections, which improves the performance of marking online/offline status as well as moving to the trash.
Updated Estonian, Greek, Japanese, Russian, and Ukrainian translations.
Small update to the photo viewer and pixbuf cache, to better prioritize background fetches.
2353: fixed crashing bug relating to importing a photo while a view filter is in place
This is the Shotwell 0.6.90 release image.
fixed bug involving ratings not being set in the database on photo import
Updated English (Great Britain) and French translations.
2296: added filter button and menu to bottom chrome
2334: F-Spot import requires less memory during run.
Updated Asturian, Chinese (Mainland PRC), Chinese (Taiwan), German, Serbian, Slovenian, and Ukrainian translations.
Updated shotwell.pot after real string freeze.
Added mnemonics to Welcome dialog checkboxes.
2337: default filter level now shows unrated or better photos
2262: Always show master file when Shift key is pressed, even if external edit is in place.
324: Accelerators of hosted page now available in fullscreen mode.
Prompts the user to import from an existing F-spot library or the system pictures directory when Shotwell is run for the first time. Closes #1908.
2304: "Already in library" changed to "duplicate photo" not imported.
2327: Changed text for rating filter strings, as discussed.
139: F-Spot migration.  Courtesy the diligent and dedicated work of Bruno Girin.  Thanks, Bruno!
2279: user can now toggle display of photo ratings
2297: Reset to default background color with Ctrl+Click on Prefs slider.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
295: Icons in sidebar, courtesy Philip Beam.
2306: Remove files from the Missing Files page.
374: Auto-import files added to library directory.
2210: Relative path now allowed when specifying database directory on command-line.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
Updated glib requirement to 2.24 (for directory monitoring).
2277: removed all code relating to hiding and favorites
2187: added progress window when deleting photos from a camera
2295: removed "or Better" from five star rating filter
Assertion fired if a duplicate tag was in the photo at import time.  This corrects the problem.
2294: Down arrow selects last photo on next row if none directly below.  Courtesy Philip Beam.

374: First commit for library monitoring.  Run with --enable-monitoring to activate.  Will scan library directory at startup and the continue monitoring the entire tree.  For now only moves, alterations, and deletes are handled.  Future work will auto-import added files and (possibly) handle symbolic links.
2234: Rating filtering. Users can filter photo display based on ratings.
The ThumbnailCache now operates over ThumbnailSources, not TransformablePhotos. This is to prepare for video handling.
Added Tobias' last name to THANKS file.
2025: Images with transparencies now painted with proper background color.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
2283: < and > keys now increase and decrease ratings
2280: user can set ratings via keypad
Updated Asturian, Chinese (Taiwan), Italian, and Thai translations.
2259: Drag-and-drop was activated when a photo was selected and a drag was initiated on a blank area of the checkerboard.
2268: Mouse wheel was still adjusting slider, even if it was insensitive (during editing, for example).
2267: Fixed configure script to work on FreeBSD (and other Unices) where bash in not installed in /bin.
Changed default cursor type in Page from ARROW to LEFT_PTR.  See #1319 and changeset 1142 for details.
2233: Added 5 star rating system, and ability to sort photos by rating.

This change addresses a long-standing issue in the DataObject/DataCollection system, being able to be notified of what was altered when an "altered" signal is fired.  The Alteration object gives details.  This change gets rid of "metadata-altered" signal, and could potentially be used to reduce other signals as well.
fixes an unticketed scrolling prblem for rename in place.
There was one oversight in the Trash code: If a trashed (i.e. unlinked) photo was destroyed (removed from
Description: trash) and it was the last photo in an unlinked ContainerSourceCollection (i.e. a Tag or an Event), the Tag or  Event would not be destroyed.  This was being taken care of at startup when the database is verified, but that's  not the right way to handle this.  This patch adds a signal for unlinked DataSources being destroyed as orphans,  allowing for the ContainerSourceCollections to clean up appropriately.

Message: fixes #2219 Fullscreen does not work correctly with multiple monitors.
Fixes #733 (rename events in place) and #2199 (allow me to rename sidebar items using F2).
2223: Mirror -> Flip Horizontally, Flip -> Flip Vertically
1858: added cursor hiding to fullscreen mode and slideshow mode.
2243: Three strings were not internationalized.  Fixed.
2244: Release notes for 0.6.1 and 0.5.1 were not added to NEWS file.  Added now.
Updated Estonian, French, and Italian translations.
2169: added keyboard shortcuts for zooming to window, zooming 100%, and zooming 200%
Merge from 0.6 branch, includes all changes for 0.6.1
2225: Library directory now defaults to XDG Pictures directory if no directory is specified by the user (entry
Description: is cleared in Preferences dialog).  If a relative path is specified, it's made relative to user's home  directory, not Shotwell's cwd.

Message: 2048: Shotwell now only offers to delete photos that successfully imported.  This patch also fixes a segfault
Description: that occurs if the user says to delete photos from a camera that is no longer available (i.e. powered down).

Message: 2224: Photos emptied from trash appear on next run fixed.
Added Lithuanian and Serbian translations, updated Italian and Spanish translations in Shotwell-0.6 branch.
Versioned as 0.6.0+branch; updated gexiv2 version requirement to 0.1.0.
2200: This patch fixes the second case Adam reported, photos being imported with no thumbnails after an import.
Description: (Simple change -- an overlooked call when BatchImport was re-factored earlier this week).  The problem of the  thumbnails not being available when the program is closed is a tougher problem.

Message: Suppresses the close button on the progress dialogs of non-cancellable operations. Closes #2207.
2213: Removing photos while importing caused assertion.  Fixed.
2214/#2215: Sidebar changes to move the cameras and importing pages up toward the top.
2205: Speed up removing large number of photos from library (especially when there are few photos per event).
2208: edit->undo is available when there are no actions to undo
2206: Original committer used state to track when Ctrl was pressed/released in regards to the mousewheel zoom
Description: functionality.  Mousewheel events can fall through to the window even when it does not have focus.  If a  mousewheel event comes through when Shotwell loses focus with the Ctrl key down (Shift+Ctrl+M), and then the  ctrl key is released, the state will not be reset until Shotwell regains focus.  Now using the modifier flags  provided by the GDK event.

Message: Fixes #2202 ("soft assertion: gtk_tree_path_compare: assertion `b != NULL' failed").
2203: Keyboard shortcut for Show in File Manager.  #2204: Keyboard shortcut for Delete in Trash Page.
2197: Full-sized export some times caused soft assertion.  Subtle timing bug.
fix for #2141: Issues with Fullscreen mode and GNOME panel.
2201: Smoothed the progress bar by skipping over non-image files during the WorkSniffer phase.
2191: space items evenly in Preferences dialog.
2194: some programs which handle RAW photos missing in Preferences dialog.
2078: Logging to file only occurs in library mode.  Direct edit mode will still log to console if
Description: SHOTWELL_LOG is set.

Message: 2033: Allows user to set library directory via a text entry box.
Makes thumbnail sort order stable across the various checkerboard views. Closes #1895.
2188: Fatal abort after interrupted batch import fixed.  Also, BatchImport wasn't cleaning up all files
Description: generated during import process after an abort; this is fixed as well.

Message: 2179: No longer recurse w/ segfault if go to fullscreen on a photo with no backing file.
1462: AppWindow now maintains its position after going to fullscreen
2184: fixed soft assertion when choosing an external editor in Windows. Fixed several bugs regarding opening an external editor on Windows relating to AppInfo quirks.
Updated the NEWS and debian changelog files to prepare for the 0.6 release.
1682: Makefile now does checking of libraw, even if not available in packaged form.
Changed the way the configure script is invoked in the debian rules file to suppress extraneous warning messages. Closes #1555.
Updated the debian/control file add runtime dependencies on librsvg2-common and dbus-x11. Closes #1766.
Removes wildcards from the definition of the DIST_FILES variable. This prevents temporary files from being included in Shotwell distribution packages. Closes #2044.
Vera discovered a corner case where a single photo import did not appear in Photos view until exiting the
Description: application, nor was an Event generated for it.  Order of operation problem; fixed.

Message: 2158, #2159: Windows dialogs display and function correctly
2111: Refactoring of BatchImport to reduce the overhead of managing background jobs and their completion
Description: callbacks, to keep the UI responsive during an import while (attempting) to not sacrifice speed.  There remains  a corner case when a large number of small files (8,000 8K JPEGs in my test case) will still swamp the UI, but  we will live with that for now ... importing that many in a responsive way will require more work, and more  consideration of BatchImport's requirements.

Message: Fixes a problem whereby the toolbar would disappear during a zoom operation in fullscreen mode. Closes #2176.
2142: fixed menu senitivities when a photo is missing.
Fixes a problem whereby the currently viewed photo in full-window mode would disappear when the context menu was shown. Closes #2178.
Made trivial changes to the ColorTransformation.vala module such that it compiles with vala 0.9.2. Closes #2164.
Fixes an problem whereby the transient toolbar in full screen mode would disappear when a zoom drag was in progress, causing the zoom state to become inconsistent then reset to default. Closes #2166.
updated sw-glade to check for shared library libshotwell.so
Properly cancels batch operations when the progress dialog's close button is clicked. Closes #2152.
2155: always ask whether to copy or link
Fixes a problem whereby opening a Foveon(tm) RAW image in direct-edit mode caused Shotwell to silently fail to start. Closes #2126.
Updated Asturian, Portuguese, and Spanish translations.

Short-circuits image scaling via the Gdk Pixbuf library during thumbnail generation for PNG images under certain highly specific conditions under which a floating point round-off error can occur. Closes #2151.

fixes #2123 Open with RAW Editor visibility not updated properly.  reverts to old widget-based control instead of action-based--the action-based had problems with setting visibility.  When this gets figured out, we'd like to go back to action-based.
fixes #2149 photo and raw editor combo boxes should have same length.
this patch changes the default time format to be based on location in the date/time adjust dialog (#2137).
Modifies exposure and ISO number metadata fetching functions to check their results for sanity. Closes #2140.
1973: Removed rotate and set background from contextual menus
Updated Bulgarian, Estonian, Italian, Spanish, and Thai translations.
2145: Crash due to keyword with invalid UTF-8 fixed.  The bad Unicode was causing Markup.escape_text() to yarf.
removes a stray setting in glade which was causing a soft assertion
2143: Added keyboard accelerators for open with editor, Return, and open with RAW editor, Return.
2139 Markup escaping required in Properties Title: field
2077: Show in File Manager command now appears on Trash Page. Required code refractoring, so that menu appears in DirectEditMode too.
fixes three preferences dialog tickets: #2132 Mnemonics issues with Preferences dialog, #2130 More padding in Browse button in Preferences, and #2131 Resizable Preferences dialog.
fixes #2125 Shotwell asks whether to copy or link when Pictures directory is missing
updates icon per #2120 fix trash/delete icons
2124: Import view was flashing wildly if window configured to a specific size.  Tricky bug!  Single piece of
Description: state was not being reset to zero when a recompute had to take place.

Message: Fixes bogus mnemonics in the Picasa Web Albums credentials capture pane. Closes #2134. As a bonus, changes the sizes of action buttons in the Picasa Web Albums credentials capture pane to accomodate long internationalized text.
Single-pixel images no longer generate critical GTK assertion failures when the Adjust palette is opened. Closes #2122.
Adjusts the layout of various panes in the publishing subsystem to better accomodate internationalized text. Fixes #2127.
2020: opens on external editor on super double click and ctrl-enter, opens raw editor on ctrl-shift-enter
2098 added Add Tags \/ Modify Tags to context menu in full-window mode.
Updates supported MIME types across source and desktop files to reflect the addition of RAW and PNG support; closes #1882.
1623: shotwell exports metadata when it can. Objects derived from TransformablePhoto now need to implement set_user_metadata_for_export(PhotoMetadata)
2112: removed ability to save RAW photo in direct edit mode.
implements #1602 link rather than copy by default when importing ...at long last

Implements some external editing changes. Fixes #2024 Update external editor in Preferences dialog while Shotwell is running, #2093 show Open With RAW Editor in context menu for RAW photos, #2094 eliminate Revert External Edits command, #2095 gray out Open With External Editor when no editor present, and #2096 Cancel button in Revert External Edit dialog.
Enables the use of internationalized characters in PicasaWeb album names. Closes #2112. As a side benefit, changes to the way PicasaWeb XML is parsed also enables us to close #1637.
Enables generation of PNG images directly from RAW pixel information, without passing through a JPEG intermediate. Closes #1875.
1951: Thumbnails don't distort as zoom level changes.
fixes #2043 Remove From Library doesn't remove photo.
1418: Shotwell detects duplicates in the current import set as well as the library.
Updated windows install-deps script to cache some of the downloaded files.
2099: Removed NO_SVG code, duplicate PNG files, and all traces of building on MacOS
Added Arabic, Asturian, Romanian translations. Updated German, Greek, Polish, Russian, Ukrainian translations.
Allows the user to resize the publishing dialog during interaction phases where resizing is applicable. Closes #1923.
Enables panning a zoomed photo in the single-photo view with the numeric keypad even if num lock is on.
1166: Initial phase of import now in background thread and cancellable by user.
Fixed unwrapped raw and GPhoto code in Shotwell source. Updated windows install-deps file to work with Shotwell 0.6. Updated Makefile to work with new dependencies, exiv2 and gexiv2.
Logs the user out of PicasaWeb if his or her authentication token has become invalid (e.g., it could've expired, or invalidated by the Google security manager, etc.). Closes #1987.
Enables panning over a photo when it is zoomed using the keyboard arrow keys. Closes #2072.
Fixes an issue whereby the Ctrl+= zoom accelerator behaved differently depending on whether or not the zoom slider had keyboard focus. Closes #2038.
Enables the user to zoom the sizes of thumbnails up or down in any CollectionPage-derived view by using the mouse wheel in conjunction with the Ctrl key. Closes #1919.
Fixes the EditingHostPage's cursor handling such that the grip-hand cursor is displayed when and only when panning is applicable, across a wide variety of cases. Closes #1911.
Updated COPYING to reflect the fact that human-icon-theme icons are
Description: now available under Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 3.0.

Message: Updated POT file to reflect newly marked up strings.
Marked up strings for translation in Resources.vala that had been overlooked by the original committer.
Fixes bug where Shotwell crashes if SHOTWELL_LOG_FILE=:console:.
Implements zoom-in/zoom-out with the mousewheel that maintains the position of the zoomed content relative to the cursor. Closes #1910.
fixes #1844 Trash interferes with dupe detection.
2063: Optionally install apport hook.  Courtesy Bruno Girin.
2000: Write log while running.  Courtest Bruno Girin.
1855: Recursive calculation of file size now properly handles permission failures when enumerating a directory.
2061: Shotwell now compiles without error or warning with Vala 0.9.1.

Updated Chinese (Mainland China), Croatian, Czech, Danish, English (Great Britain), Finnish, French, German, Greek, Polish, Punjabi, Norwegian, Russian, Slovenian, Ukrainian translations following string freeze for 0.6 release.
First round of commits for Canon EOS 50D fixes.  Hope this will make headway on #1852.
Evens out the zoom scale such that each tick corresponds to multiplying the zoom level by a constant, adaptive factor. Closes #1943.
2004/#1344: No longer using libusb to map gPhoto camera objects to USB ports.  gudev gives us all the
Description: information we need.  Thanks to Bruno Girin.

Message: Updated pot file following string freeze in anticipation for 0.6 release.
Changed importing dialogs and import menu strings

fixes #2018 background color slider in preferences is too long, #2031 [strings] warn user if Pictures directory is ~, #2041 [strings] preferences dialog label nit, and changes the preferences dialog alignment to be GNOME HIG compliant.
Merged NEWS file from the 0.5.x branch into trunk so the release history is properly reflected on the wiki. Closes #2007.

Changes the Facebook service welcome message in the publishing dialog such that the user is informed that he/she must grant Shotwell Connect certain permissions in order for it to function properly. Closes #1982.
Updated Slovenian translation, added plural forms to Croation translation.
Removed mnemonic collisions in various menus

Updated all translation files to support gettext lookup on the 'translator-credits' msgid to allow display of translator credits in the "About..." box; changed "About..." box invocation code in the AppWindow class to inject a translator credits pane. Closes #2005.
2039: I18N "modified" suffix for externally editable files.
Changed dimensions to display multiplication sign rather than the letter x
One liner fix for #1885 photo jumps when scaled.
fixes #2022 (direct-edit mode is broken), #1997 (Close image viewer with Escape), and #2015 (in Preferences dialog, indent labels relative to section headers).

Constitutes a total re-write of the zooming subsystem, introducing the new ZoomBuffer class that takes advantage of parellelism and clever case-specific optimizations to significantly improve zooming performance. Closes #1906 as well.
Fix of DnD bug, now on_motion attempts to stop DnD events in addition to on_left_click
Makefile tab thing and a minor bug fix.
Added PNG thumbnail support to ThumbnailCache, and changed the interface with ThumbnailCache to use LibraryPhoto instead of PhotoID
fixes #1974 Select external editor in Preferences dialog
Added coment to EditingHostPage regarding assert statement
1834: Preferences dialog now non-modal thanks to Marcel Stimberg.
423: Small corruption when dragging crop tool corners resolved courtesy Josh Freeman.
1851: Catches long filenames and skips them before calling gPhoto functions which perform unchecked strcpy's.
Fixed bug in Page::update_modifiers(), so that internal key modifier variables are in sync with poll
1995: Support for Canon's owner name in artist field.

Fixed crash introduced to fix ticket 1991. Updated PageCommand to allow it to properly restore the LibraryPhotoPage to its previous state as undos are executed, and introduced assert in switched_to to check for future bugs involving an empty view.
fixes #1556 don't allow Page Up/Down to affect zoom slider (reopened for home/end keys) and #1957 preferences dialog should be hidden when Shotwell is minimized
1909: Faster export by parallelizing the exports in background threads.  This also keeps the UI thread free to
Description: update.

Message: EditingHostPage now clears its ViewCollection in switching_from, so non-active LibraryPhotoPages do reference a photo.
adds Remove From Library Command, per ticket #1756.  Also adds Delete in the Trash Page.
Added comment to EditingTools.vala regarding ticket 1946
Added Tags menu to LibraryPhotoPage.  Restructured ModifyTagsDialog to accept a photo, and updated code in CollectionPage to use the new ModifyTagsDialog constructor.
1552: Jump to file in file manager
One slight change to the externally editable commit: orientation (which is a transformation) should only be held
Description: in PhotoTable.  BackingPhotoTable should only hold the source file's original_orientation.  This keeps all  transformations in PhotoTable, freeing BackingPhotoTable to merely store what the backing photo's pristine  state.

Message: fixes #1075 Allow User to specify import directory
Added check to PhotoRenameDialog for a null string return from execute that was causing a soft assert.
1978: Close application properly when Alt+F4 is pressed in fullscreen mode.
fixes #1956 by revamping the properties class

Removed the Display Borders preference checkbox. Removed checkbox object from Dialogs.vala, shotwell.glade, shotwell.schema.  Removed the save and load commands in Config.vala. Updated the get_border_width() function in CheckerboardLayout.vala to reflect a constant border with.
1479: Open with external editor.  Currently the editor is hardcoded as GIMP (/usr/bin/gimp), but this will
Description: change with #1974 (Select external editor in Preferences dialog).

Message: Removed "move to" comment from drag and drop import dialog, and added keyboard mnemonics for import and copy.
1939: Addresses oddball EXIF date/time format in Minolta DiMAGE E223.
1967: Added Restore label to button on Trash Page.
959: Center color adjustment sliders with Ctrl+LMB.
Correct a software distribution error whereby the shotwell.glade definition file wasn't included in the RESOURCE_FILES list.
Added Thai translation, updated Czech translation.
Some of the rotations in Orientation were improperly mapped.  The recent Flip command exposed them.
Eliminates GTK assertion errors that appeared when working with PNG images in direct-edit mode. Closes #1937.
Bumps the MAX_PHOTO_DIMENSION constant in the FacebookConnector to 720 pixels. Closes #1922.
fixes #1912 welcome dialog shouldn't have a separator

fixes four tickets: #1820 (Don't reflow CheckerboardLayout if not in view), #1866 (version compatibility message is confusing), #1881 (crop, red-eye, adjust should have keyboard shortcuts), and #1915 (flip image vertically).
Properly handles file extensions on Save As... in direct-edit mode. Closes #1876.
fixes #1535 (improve Import Complete dialog) and #1809 (jump to camera view when camera is connected)
fixes #1819 drag and drop export is broken
fixes #1898 (direct edit crashes on loading photo with unexpected orientation) and #1806 (Tag with ampersand in title causes Pango warning)
This corrects a number of bugs uncovered by the Google Nexus One.
shaves off a few seconds for #1892 opening a a RAW photo in direct-edit is slow
1893: iPhoto titles/descriptions now supported.  Better metadata tag coverage for title/descriptions in
Description: general.

Message: Added Czech translation, updated Finnish translation.
Enables zooming via the mouse wheel in full window, direct edit and full screen modes. Closes #1796.
1886: Set as Desktop Background no longer abends with RAW photos.
1852: Although I cannot reproduce this, I do see how this can occur.  I believe this fixes the problem.
1828: Added better null-checking for selection paths in the sidebar.
This fixes a double-free in PhotoMetadata.
Enables the use of the 0, 1, and 2 keys as hotkeys that snap the image zoom level to min, isomorphic, and max, respectively, in full-window, full-screen, and direct-edit modes. Closes #1706.
1714: Dupe detection works for RAW now.
fixes #1862 (exit full screen on double click).
1877: Typo and an oversight conspired to kill dupe detection.
1291: Got tired of mucking around with directories to make sure I wasn't putting my personal library at risk as I developed new code.  This is a basic command-line implementation, but it suffices.
a step forward on #894 (display selection rectangle in focus-specific color) and #1873 (don't colorize photo text on selection).  exact colors can be re-examined later.
Updated Chinese (China) translation, added Chinese (Taiwan) translation.
This is something I've wanted to do for a while now: SortedList is now a Gee.Collection and DataCollection
Description: exports its lists as Gee.Collections.  This will make it more flexible for callers.  It may be worthwhile to  make these read-only views, but that would require more testing.

Message: fixes tickets #1556 (don't allow Page Up/Down to affect zoom slider) and #1576 (Right click support for import from camera).
1868: Previews now load from camera without problem.
fixes tickets #1848 (multiline title messes up Basic Information pane) and #1867 (use [ and ] for rotating left/right).
1761 Selected picture not updated in single picture mode
Being more selective about what constitutes a title now.
fixes #1842 (Export dialog doesn't preserve settings between invocations) and #1535 (improve Import Complete dialog).
1693: Migrated from libexif to exiv2 via gexiv2.  Note that libexif is still a dependency due to an outstanding
Description: issue obtaining the EXIF binary block for MD5 hashing.  #1740: EXIF <-> PNG operational.  #1683: Display EXIF  information in RAW photos now fully functional (as much as Exiv2 supports them).

Message: unmarked a string in glade so it will not be translated
implements #894 display selection rectangle in focus-specific color
Merged comments into POT file. This is the definitive version of the POT file for this weekly POT regen.
Injected temporary fixes into POT file as part of Transifex debuggin'.
Fixes significant user interface issues with single-photo zoom. Closes #1774.
fixes #1595 Include Windows-specific files in source tarballs

Allows converting between image file formats at export time (and via "Save As..." in direct-edit mode); this closes ticket #1598. As a bonus, also resolves #1817 "exporting multiple scaled-down photos broken".
fixes #894 display selection rectangle in focus-specific color
1835: Move to Trash item properly sensitized.
implements display border around each photo, which is part of #1304
Adds basic PNG support. Closes ticket #602.
1708: update copyright lines in source code to 2010
937: Progress bar now expands to fill toolbar with text centered.  Patch courtesy Matt Jones.
fixes #1762 Black screen after full screen and #1763 Photos with blank ImageDescriptions should be treated as no title at all
fixes #1751: Checkerboard not updated when photo hidden or deleted
re-added deleted text_entry_dialog to glade file.
implements #1574: allow user to set thumbnail background color
Allows user to zoom in and out of photos in the single picture library view, the direct edit view, and the full screen view. Closes #1162.
Fixes a problem with the way login redirect urls are parsed with new accounts in the facebook publishing subsystem. Closes bug #1696.
Better handling of linking to libraw in the Makefile (specifically for Vala build bot).  Also, gudev #define
Description: only added to gcc command if on Linux (which is the only platform today with udev).

Message: fixes #857, keeping the current photos in view when adjusting the thumbnail slider
Further work on the libraw bindings.
I went through and culled all references in the comments to Vala bugzilla reports that have been resolved as of
Description: 0.8.0.  I corrected the code and removed the comment references.  I also updated a couple of the references that  were duplicates of other reports.

Message: 1684: This is a first commit toward support for importing RAW files from cameras.  The current test case (Canon
Description: S90) has this problem: gPhoto will return the thumbnail for the RAW image, but no EXIF.  When the CR2 file is  copied to the local machine, it's possible to extract the EXIF from the embedded JPEG file, but not the EXIF  thumbnail.  This mismatch kills dupe detection.

Message: Fixed #1691 (exit more gently on bad command-line argument).
implements #1533: ability to edit photo titles
522: Using auto-brightness for RAW color correction.  See #1694.
1530 allows Shotwell to build using Glade dialogs.  TextEntryDialog is the working example.
Added thumbnail support to all PhotoReaders.
This fix solves a problem in EditingHostPage where two requests for the same pixbuf may occur: one in the
Description: background as a prefetch and the other as a blocked fetch.

Message: 1346: Removed our custom FStream.vapi now that FileStream supports random access I/O.
1613: Removed local gudev bindings -- now part of Vala std dist.
This fixes a dimensions problem with certain RAW files (those from Fuji cameras, as it turns out) and improves
Description: exception reporting in GRaw.

Message: 522: Initial commit for 8-bit RAW support.  This commit provides support for file import (but not from camera),
Description: JPEG mimicking (to prevent full-sized RAW decodes and processing whenever possible), and a file format  abstraction layer in anticipation of PNG and TIFF support. Some RAW files do not display correctly; some have odd dimensions, other have color problems.  I'm investigating  these currently.  Also, to improve import time, instead of displaying a full-window pixbuf of each photo as it's  loaded, the largest thumbnail is displayed instead.  This behavior can be reinstated, if deemed important.

Message: fixes #1152: photos with no/bogus time create 1969 events
Further improvements to scaling operations on thumbnails and CheckerboardLayout.
This fixes a problem with large collections with loading thumbnails.
More fixed warnings for the next version of Vala.
Removes warnings seen on the Vala buildbot (will be seen in the next release of Vala).
This simplifies the CheckerboardLayout code, which relied on a more complicated scheme to reflow the layout and
Description: report exposed/unexposed to the CheckerboardItems.  This change centralizes the state changes and handles them  in the expose-event in a more intelligent manner.

Message: Added Ukrainian translation ; updated Makefile to include language code UK in SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES ; added translator's name to the THANKS file.
Merged PO file changes, Makefile dependency corrections, and Windows install bug fixes from the 0.5 branch into trunk.
Added English (Great Britain & Northern Ireland) translation ; modified Makefile to add en_GB to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES ; added translators name to THANKS file.
Added Hungarian PO file mistakenly omitted from last commit; updated THANKS file to acknowledge name of translator.
Updated PO and POT file version string to "shotwell-0.5.1+branch" ; added Hungarian translation.
Changed the version number in winstall.iss to 0.5.1 ; this updates the Shotwell 0.5.1 release image.
Updated the README file to correct an outdated URL; this updates the 0.5.1 release image.
This is the Shotwell 0.5.1 release image. Note that Shotwell 0.5.1 is a minor, Windows-only release that fixes a broken installer on Windows.
Backing off version number to 0.5.0+branch until final release.
Fixed Windows installer; updated version number to 0.5.1.
Fall back to GTK 2.16.6 on Windows.
fixes 3 mnemonic tickets and updates version to +trunk (#1514, #1515, #1516)
Opening branch for the Shotwell 0.5.x release stream.
Updated rules and changelog files to strip symbols in lauchpad builds; closes #1349.
This revision is the 0.5.0 release image.
Updated Makefile to add dbus-glib dependency.
Added X-Poedit-Language metadata fields to po files that were lacking theme.
1485: Fixes it so current photo in full-window mode is always selected when returning to the Photos page.  Also
Description: fixes a separate bug (reported in the same ticket) where the photo is not selected if no navigation occurs in  full-window mode.

Message: Discovered a bug where if the user resizes the window while in full-window mode then returns to the Photos page,
Description: the thumbnails are missing.  This is due to some changes in the flicker reducing code checked in earlier.  This  fixes the problem.

Message: 1548: Exported files are now copied with default target permissions.
fixes #1541 give initial focus to photo collection
1474: These workarounds fix a bug that is current in Vala trunk today:
Description: https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=612315

Message: 1538/#1018/#1534: Various flicker problems in CheckerboardLayout fixed by more aggressive batching of updates
Description: into single queue_redraw_for_area() commands, as well as scheduling the reflow higher in the event queue to  reduce the number of exposure events.

Message: Updated Simplified Chinese (Mainland China/PRC dialect translation).
Updated French translation; note that French translation now carries version 0.5.0.
1525: Improved log message displayed when creating database.
1539: The reason the photos triggered a false positive in the dupe detection code is that they have no
Description: thumbnail but the exact same EXIF.  Now dupe detection requires that both EXIF and the thumbnail are present,  otherwise a full content comparision will be performed.

Message: 1519: segault on import solved.  Problem relates to #1520 (also closed in this commit).  Completion callback
Description: was being re-entered due to the thumbnail import code calling spin_event_loop() (which is a legacy aspect of the  old-style import, which was serialized in the main event thread).  Additionally, the BatchImport object was  being derefed and freed because the Workers/BackgroundJob system does not maintain a reference to the object  with the callbacks; this has been remedied.

Message: fixes #1521 [lucid] Set as Desktop Background fails when run a second time, #1522 suggested wallpaper changes and #1523 unable to export background: permission denied
Places Welcome dialog in the native Dialog position used by the window manager; closes #1537.
Resolves progress dialog positioning issues; closes ticket #1051.
fixes #1492 assertion failure when exporting to Computer folder and #1497 import from Trash hangs
Fixes Facebook ampersand encoding problem; closes #1531.

Disallows publishing to Picasa Web Albums when the user enters a new album name that is solely whitespace (resolves #1526); HTML entity encodes the characters '&', '>' and '<' when the user uses them in the name of a new album when publishing to Picasa Web Albums (resolves #1528).
