1518: Duplicate after hide results in assertion fixed; problem due to order of notifications being propagated
Description: (subclasses of DataCollection needed to integrate the duplicated objects in their data structures before the  objects themselves began performing operations).

Message: 1517: Fixes Modify Tags command segfaulting if the photo has no tags.
1496 (event is not visible in sidebar after time change)
Improves the layout of the "Image Settings" pane in the Print dialog; closes ticket #1476.
fixes #1510 don't show time adjustment options in direct edit
1513: Fixes moving photo from one event to another segfaulting.
1484: Using rounded corners instead of curved rectangles for EventDirectoryPage.
fortgot to remove a printf before commit
fixes #1507 Warning message about PrintPlaceholder in full-window mode and #1509 Apply button should be called OK in Crop and Adjust windows
1118: Further work to improve startup time.
Updated POT file; this is the Shotwell 0.5.0 release string-freeze POT file.
Modified the Makefile and the .desktop files to enable translation of desktop file entries through the normal PO/POT mechanism; updated French translation to test this functionality.
1481/#1482/#1483: Fixes a multitude of problems exposed by glib-2.23 due to this bug in valac:
Description: https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=611845  We must ensure that all objects passed by signals inherit  from Object until this bug is fixed.

Message: The commit Implements asynchronous publishing across all supported web services. It also closes the following tickets: #1135, #1138, #1139, #1316, #1347, #1370, #1477, #1149.
Updated Chinese (Mainland China/PRC dialect) and Polish translations.
fixes #1500 single photo page to sidebar drag
fixes #1501 debug build crashes on startup
fixes two multi-monitor related bugs: #1461 External monitor fullscreen toolbar misplaced and #1468 fullscreen view is not on correct monitor
fixes tickets #1495 [strings] progress windows should conform to interface guidelines and #1491 [strings] offer to Replace All in export dialog
Fix for multiple trinkets from Martin Robinson.
fixes #1472 [strings] Modify Original -> Modify original (files) and #1475 [strings] inconsistent capitalization
fixes #1469 fullscreen segfault, #1470 remove New Event from context menu#1471 duplicate mnemonic in Photos menu.
1417: Fixes problem of dragging hundreds of photos by using XDS instead of standard GTK drag-and-drop when
Description: dealing with Nautilus.  Because of this change, photo export is remarkably simpler.  Also, refactored the DnD  export code out to a separate class, and the batch export code to a separate function.  Also, a case where  dropping 5000 photos onto a tag being excessively slow is fixed.

Message: fixes #1084 don't report import errors for non-image files and #1409 Help->Contents should go to UsingShotwell0.5
fixes #1405 [windows] don't display Set as Desktop Background
fixes #1428 use typographic right arrow in welcome dialog
Use GTK 2.18.1 on Windows; it was the last binary version built without GTK+.

Changed three characters in one string in the Welcome dialog: replaced three raw bullet characters ("•") with their corresponding HTML character entity codes ("•" -- correctly interpreted by Pango). This was necessary because the bullet character is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane, and the GNU gettext tools don't support strings containing characters outside of the basic ASCII plane as inputs for translation.

Replaced one character in one string: in the Welcome dialog, I replaced a typographic right arrow ("▸") with a right angle bracket (">"). This was necessary because the typographic right arrow is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane and xgettext doesn't support translation input strings that contain characters outside of the basic ASCII plane.
Normalized copyright dates and version numbers (version == shotwell-0.4.3+trunk) across all language files.
Added Punjabi translation; updated Makefile to add ISO language code PA to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES; added translator's name to THANKS file.
Added Russian translation; updated Makefile to add ISO language code RU to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES list; added translator's name to THANKS file.
Added Greek translation; updated Makefile to add ISO language code EL to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES list; added translators name to THANKS file.
1413: If no tag in a row of photos, empty space is not consumed (but bottom-alignment remains).
adds feature #438 welcome screen for new users
Not an error if the theme file is missing.  Force update even if cache may
Description: be up-to-date.

Message: 1412: Tags branch in sidebar now expanded at startup.  #1360: Set Tag (now Modify Tags) no longer leaves the selection cursor on the tag although not viewing it.  #1348: Likewise, tag drag-and-drop doesn't leave the cursor on the tag.
1313 Keep relativity in adjust date/time dialog was unclear, so we added a radio buttons for each option: batch change and relative shift.
1416: Oops.  Needed to call virtual method before using context menu object.
1090: Display Basic Information and View Tags default to true, but GConf doesn't throw an error when a key is
Description: missing, so our defaults are not used.

Message: 1341 was mostly fixed as fallout of other fixes, but this fixes the last remaining case
1371 dragging to sidebar shouldn't offer insertion between rows
1233: Fixed SD card support.  Needed to tell udev what subsystem to monitor for SD support ("block").
1400: Selection frame now drawn around the thumbnail image only, with the title and tag text merely changing to
Description: the selection color.

Message: 595: Move delete files to desktop trash can.  I've implemented this ahead of the trash can changes because I
Description: realized there were some string changes required and wanted to get them in ASAP.

Message: 1357: Replace New Tag with Add Tags...  Also, renamed Set Tags... to Modify Tags...
1378: Exif.alloc_entry fixed.  libexif appears to never set the Exif.Data data_type (i.e. data arrangement)
Description: field, so this must be done every time.  Fixed in PhotoExif.

Message: 1345: Local GTK bindings no longer necessary (fixed in 0.7.10).
1374: Fixed problem with New Tags command and redoing and undone command.
1373: "Remove Tag from Photos" -> "Remove Tag From Photos".  #1372: Better input validation with New Tag and Rename Tag.
Added tooltips to checkerboard page, works for photo name and tags (but especially useful for tags).
1369: Rename tag followed by delete tag yielded an assert.  Map of names -> Tags was kept but did not monitor
Description: renames, hence the problem.

Message: 1366: Fatal error when renaming tag to name of existing tag resolved.
1368: Fixed refreshing thumbnail tag list when tags renamed or destroyed.
Slideshow was never ported to the new PixbufCache (which uses background threads), and continued to use the Idle
Description: queue to load the next pixbuf.  This remedies this situation.

Message: 1359: Tag name included in menu commands.
1358: Tags menu items reorganized, moving all to Tags menu.  Internationalizable plural extra credit included.
1356: Delete Tag now presents a confirmation dialog before proceeding.
1355: This commit looks scarier than it really is for this ticket.  Displays each photo's tags beneath the
Description: title, and can be toggled on and off.  Changed the name of the checkerboard item object (been meaning to do that  for some time), which is a lot of the diffs.  Also added a mechanism for setting properties on an entire  ViewCollection, which is a more centralized system than the way we were toggling title and thumbnail size  before.

Message: implements #1195 inibit screensaver while slideshow running.  This is for gnome-screensver only, and we should implement X11 and windows-specific screensaver disables as well.
1352: Import no longer hangs when importing nothing but photos already in library.
Enables Publishing to Google's Picasa Web Albums service; closes bug #667.
fixes #1338 Triple-click in Extended Properties info window should select a single line of text and #1185 Mark as favorite in single photo view.  Also implemented mark as hidden in single photo view.
fixes #1350 extended properties box floats above non-shotwell windows and #1343 Context-menu not available in direct-edit mode
Forgot to add tags.ui to project.
1329: Drag-and-drop photos onto tag.  Still some wonkiness with the sidebar selector, which needs to be addressed.
79: Tags.  This first commit sets up the plumbing for tags and implements a basic mechanism for adding/removing
Description: tags to a single photo.

Message: 1206: Stricter EXIF checking.  Possibly fixes #1310, but want to wait and get photo file from user to verify.
Photos were not being added to database in direct-edit mode.
1207: Photos in import/camera view now sorted by exposure time.
Added Simplified Chinese (Mainland China/PRC dialect) translation; added ISO language code zh_CN to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES list in Makefile ; added translator's name to THANKS file.
fixes #1200 Support context menu key, #1204 View original photo should check for other modifier keys, and #1311 directories listed as unimported photos.
1327 Extended Properties text selected when window opened
Added Danish translation; updated Makefile to add ISO language code DA to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES list; added translator's name to THANKS file.

fixes the following three bugs: #1186 Exposure time fraction issues, #1164 when scanning, exclude directories beginning with a period, and #1302 text in Remove dialog should be pluralized when appropriate

Description: Fixed #1319 (rightward pointing mouse cursor).

Message: fixes a bug (unticketed?) where photos without any exif data at all aren't appropriately when the exposure time is changed.
fixes #1312 Adjust Date and Time displays 1969 when no EXIF data
With Allison's recent changes to updating time/date adjustment, need to notify DataCollection observers of a
Description: possible re-sort when this happens.

Message: While testing found a bug when resizing for 1x1 pixel image ... Gdk.Pixbuf.scale_simple will hang if resizing a
Description: large image (its 360x360 thumbnail) to a 1x1 image, or anything below 5x5.  Added code to enforce sane minimums  when resizing.

Message: fixes #1119 and #1120, making property info selectable
Rolled back gudev requirement to 145 for out-of-the-box Fedora 12 support.
Updated French translation. Added Dutch and Spanish translations; updated Makefile to add ISO language codes NL and ES to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES list; updated THANKS file to acknowledge translators.
531: Disable synchronizing commits in database to speed up insert/updates time (which helps import
Description: tremendously).  Also removed the essentially unused ThumbnailCache tables, which helps when generating  thumbnails.

Message: Added a comment to the POT file to remove an ambiguity pointed out in a mailing list post.

Fixed two string glitches that had caused trouble for translators -- one string was broken over two lines and so was truncated in the POT file; the other string lacked appropriate context. Updated the POT file accordingly.
Implemented #1142 (-h or --help should print command-line options).
Fixed #1300: "Shotwell Photo Manager" in Applications menu
Fixed #1303 (Edit->Remove should use red minus sign icon).
531: Importing now takes place completely in background threads.  Thumbnails are generated in background, but
Description: they are written in the foreground; this could be avoided with more work.

Message: Allows user to specify printing resolution in pixels per inch. Closes #1277.
Allows user to specify a custom size for printing or choose from a pre-selected menu of standard photo frame sizes. Closes #1276.

implements #1179, giving the user the option to update the exif data when adjusting the date/time of a photo.  also implements #1289, but brought to our attention #1295 and that the feature isn't implemented for direct edit (soon to be ticketed)
implements set photo as desktop background feature
Added Bengali translation file; updated Makefile to add ISO language code BN to supported languages list; updated THANKS file to acknowledge translator.
Updated French translation; added translator's name to THANKS file.
This fixes the binding fix we have in the custom GTK+ vapi.  It also adds a comment and a link to the bug report
Description: so we know when this vapi is no longer needed and we can use the distributed version.

Message: Further optimizations toward #1118.  The big win in this round is speeding up Page lookups in the Sidebar.
1118: A variety of patches to speed up startup time.  More work may follow, but this patch was getting large
Description: enough I wanted to commit.  SortedList has serious performance improvements.

Message: Adds support for the Gtk+ standard page setup dialog, closes #1275.
1237: Fixed.  Now attempting to initialize camera when the "unmounted" signal is fired rather than when the
Description: unmount callback is invoked.

Message: Merge Windows installation updates from 0.4 branch.
999: HAL dependency removed.  Now using GUdev (GObject wrapper around libudev).
Fixed #1238 ([windows] wrong theme when MinGW is not installed).
Allow building the Windows installer from the command line.
Merged in new & changed translations from trunk; updated Makefile to add new translations to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES list; updated THANKS file to acknowledge translators.
Updated version number and header information in current translation files to have version 0.4.2+trunk.
Added Bulgarian translation; updated Makefile to add ISO langauge code BG to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES; updated THANKS file to acknowledge translator.
Fixed #1229 ([windows] won't run without DLLs in c:\MinGW).
Added Portuguese translation; updated makefile to add ISO language code PT to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES; added translator to THANKS file.
Added new Latvian translation; updated Makefile to add ISO language code LV (Latvian) to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES; added translator's name to THANKS file.
Grooming DataCollection to consolidate code that had started to creep between DataCollection and ViewCollection.
Description: This will help us in the future when we optimize some of DataCollection's code.  Also fixed an unchecked  Exception in Dialogs.vala.

Message: 1232: ImportSources were improperly removed from their SourceCollection, causing the assertion.
1215: Now using a simple script to verify compiler version numbers.
Added Swedish translation; updated THANKS file to acknowledge translator (Daniel Nylander).
Updated German, Italian, and Swedish translations. Added Slovak translation. Changed THANKS file and Makefile to reflect new languages and contributors.
1217: Fixed import perf regression.  Now relying on thumbnail generation to detect bogus image files.
1198: Display progress on startup if the user's library is large enough to warrant it.  Also some optimizations
Description: to improve startup time.

Message: Updated version number in Windows install script.
1208: Red-eye failure due to a rounding error.
1211: Made the PhotoInterrogator check the actual encoding of the JPEG file.  Previously it used PixbufLoader,
Description: but only going so far as to the first decoded block.

Message: 1209/#1210: Strengthened malformed EXIF checking, removing assertions and replacing them with error-handling
Description: code.  This fixes parsing EXIF structure for photos with bogus EXIF.

Message: 1201: Export/publish no longer fails on photos that have EXIF but no orientation tag.  Also, Shotwell now
Description: requires 0.7.9, as one of the bindings it relies upon has been fixed.

Message: 1203: Photo caused crash on import due to rounding.  The photo is so wide and short its height was being scaled
Description: to zero.  Now, all scaled dimensions are returned floored at least to one in both dimensions.  This patch also  fixes a problem with the crop/redeye tools on small/narrow/short photos (due to their displayed, scaled  size).

Message: Closes #1193; allows adjustment of bilevel images.
1194: Now greying out the crop (and red-eye) tool when images are too small for them.
fixes #1191, allowing parts of the gconf schema to install properly.
1183: Now display ISO, exposure, and/or aperture when available, even if not all are available.
1176: More event generation issues, this time when photos all are in the morning before the event boundary
Description: (4AM).  #1174/#1181: We're now more aggressive searching the JPEG file for EXIF.  This solves the problem of  some photos (either from GIMP or from certain cameras) not being recognized as having EXIF in them.

Message: removes publishing menu item on windows build.
1165: Shotwell no longer aborts when import runs out of disk space.  The import will halt and the user will be
Description: presented an error dialog.  Also, fixed Events so small thumbnails are enlarged to fit the square, guaranteeing  all are the same size in the checkerboard display.

Message: reduces number of significant digits displayed for exposure.
1163: Import of 160x3 image no longer causes assertion.  #1168: Shotwell would attempt to import files without
Description: supported filename extensions if it was a directory import opertion.  This is now circumvented.  Also,  fixed a rounding error in the EventDirectoryItem code related to rounding-corners that caused some key  photos to not be displayed.

Message: Fixed a multi-byte code point issue with the new Pango markup used in the events directory page; merged translation files against current POT file; verified that all translations function as expecte with the 0.4 source tree.
removes minimize and maximize decorations on extended info window, fixing #1154
1155: Ctrl++ and Ctrl+- now accelerator keys for zooming.  Code also checks for unadorned plus and minus, or
Description: those keys with any modifier key, in fact.

Message: 1153: Events now displayed as a squared key photo with rounded corners, with its name centered and in boldface,
Description: with the number of photos in the event below that in smaller font.

Message: Added the new pin toolbar icon.
Fixed capitalization in the Extended Information window.
Fixes a problem with generating too many events when photos are on the same day.
1145/#1146: These were caused by the programmatic switching of pages.  Some of the other controls (in this
Description: case, the Gtk.TreeView) allow for events to be processed in their own handlers, and causing an expose_event to  be called before Page.switched_to() was invoked.  This is safe, but an assertion was in place to check for pages  being seen when they weren't supposed to.  Since this can happen during a switch, removing this assertion.

Message: 973: Display corruption when dragging below the last photo in GTK+ 2.18.  There appears to be a change in how
Description: Gtk.Adjustment values are clamped between 2.16 and 2.18.  This patch enforces the limit.

Message: 1130: Now detecting bogus EXIF timestamps and treating them as through they're unset.  Will need more work if
Description: want to ignore them in some cases and use them in others.

Message: Closes #1047 (Facebook publishing should fail gracefully if user has deauthorized application); user is now gracefully logged out when a 102 (session key has become invalid) error is detected.
Closes #1089 (favorites star icon needs touching up).
1122: Photos now imported into proper events, respecting the new event boundary algorithm.  #1134: Help ->
Description: Contents now goes to new Wiki page.

Message: Branching in preparation for the 0.4 release.

Resolves #1136 ("can't publish to Facebook" -- occurred with newly created Facebook accounts where no photo albums were present); makes Publishing dialog taller to accomodate changed Facebook pane layout.
1137: Needed to monitor the destruction of the duplicated photo and reset the command manager if it occurs.
Refinement to the web publishing error reporting.
1124: More fine-grained error reporting in Web publishing.  PublishingError used more thoughly throughout to
Description: facilitate error reporting.

Message: Adds new POT file with proper plural forms to the po/ directory; closes #1079.
First commit toward #1124: Finer-grained exceptions in the publishing code.  Added preliminary strings for error
Description: messages for string freeze.

Message: Resolves bug #1126 ("publishing dialog buttons should have access keys")
fixes #1121 (extended info window should be wider) and implements #1019 (publish item in dropdown).
Changed all gettext invocations in strings with embedded numbers to ngettext calls to support proper plural form handling for non-Western languages.
adds persistence of sort settings for events, photos within events, and library photos.  #1104 and #1103.
Introduces a unified publishing subsystem, closes bug #181 ("Export photos to Flickr").
874: Gap threshold increased to one event per day, with the boundary being 4AM.
Updated minimal version number for WebKit.
Added version checks for webkit, libsoup and libxml.  This fixes #1015.
1102: Bug due to rounding down to zero in integer division.
873: Import and directory reads were slowing down moving between photos in direct-edit mode.  Import is much
Description: faster now (and faster for library mode as well!) and the directory is only read once.  Will need to later  monitor the directory for file additions/removals.  #1106: Modified asterisk now working.  Also fixed other  little bit rots in direct-edit mode that had gone undetected.

Message: Added get_int() and set_int() to the Windows GConf implementation.
takes care of ticket 1096--both of the cases where hiding photos should make the toolbar buttons unavailable.
1100: get_start_time()/get_end_time() fixed and now using all photos, including hidden, when calculating.
Improves toolbar layout (#1045) by removing new event and adding in a separator.
fixes 1083 so maximization state and window dimensions are remembered.  also changes basic properties to default on
fixes 935, making select_all work for event directory pages.
774: In full-window/fullscreen mode, images now shown in actual size.  In slideshow, images shown fullscreen.
Added Mattias to THANKS file.  Alphabetized names.
Added Estonian translation file; updated Makefile languages line to include "et".
Polish translation file is now complete.
871: Mark as Favorite implemented.  Some questions remain about the favorite icon and whether the hidden icon
Description: should be similarly sized/placed or back in its original location/size.

Message: fixes 1070: app hangs while parsing events after large import.  added progress dialog.
Fixed bug #1074 (about box links don't work).
1085: GTK assertion due to signal being fired before import queue page was hidden.  Assertion due to hidden
Description: pages maintaining their PageLayout even when hidden.

Message: 1069: Pages are now destroyed when removed from LibraryWindow, and each Page destroys all the widgets it
Description: creates that are not contained/parented when the Page is destroyed (i.e. the menu bar).  This issue was  exacerbated by drag-and-drop, which obtains references on all widgets in the application and releases them after  the Page was deref'ed.

Message: fixes #1061 (hidden photo titles not displayed) and related hidden thumbnail size not updating
fixes 1044: Shift key does not work after window resize
cleaning up how modifiers behave with change of focus, page switching, etc.  Inspired by #1049
Updated the THANKS file to include a translations section.
Added Polish translation file; updated German translation file
fixes 1055, tool dialogs not appearing in fullscreen mode.
1067: Undo drag-and-drop move photos to event no longer asserts.  Also cleaned up some code that, in this
Description: particular code path, was preventing Pages from being fully unref'ed.

Message: fixes access key bugs 1060, 1062, and 1063.  adds hide command to photo context menu.
1066: Fixed assertion triggered when using Ctrl+H to hide an item while the mouse was hovering over it.
Due to changes for Hide/Unhide, some assertions improperly fire in DataCollection.  This has to do with
Description: ViewCollection filtering.  This fixes that so the assertions are properly checked.

Message: 1032: Assertion due to pages being double-freed -- forgot to clear the lists.
fixes 1064: remove mirror from context menu
fixes 954: down arrow gives focus to toolbar, up arrow doesn't give focus back
Resolves bug #1046 (can't log out of Facebook and log in as a different user)
Changed Makefile to support installing German and Italian translations; changed Makefile such that POT strings template file (shotwell.pot) is included in the distribution tarball.
Added user-submitted German translation; fixed POEdit metadata in French and Italian translation files; fixed POEdit metadata in POT strings template file.
1058/#1059: Both were related to how hidden photos are handled inside the ViewCollection.  Now reinforcing
Description: interface where a ViewFilter must be used to control hidden-ness.  Also, found a minor bug where the "View ->  Hidden Photos" was not keeping its state when switching between pages.

Message: fixes 940: Export Photo dialog should conform to interface, 960: progress dialog should conform to interface, 972: uneven selection margin
1054: Direct-load icons need to be copied now if they're to be modified (which the histogram control does to
Description: theme the nubs).

Message: Fixes bug #1030, "Facebook login yields segmentation fault."

implements 964: move photos between events and fixes 1004: move Zoom In, Zoom Out to View menu, 1027: slideshow delay defaults to 1 second, and 936: Make Key Photo in context menu is available when more than one photo is selected
1029: Fixes bug where second import would cause a crash.
879: Delete open photo (i.e. when in full-window or fullscreen mode)
Eliminated a couple of build warnings on Windows.
This change adds an alternate GConf implementation to be used only on Windows and Mac OS.
Description: It simply writes out GConf settings to an .ini file. This fixes bug #968 ([windows] wait cursor displays for 5 seconds at startup).

Message: Fixed a typo in the extended properties view.
Added binutils as a Shotwell build dependency; it contains the windres binary which
Description: we use for adding an icon to the Shotwell executable.

Message: 65/#1001: Undo/redo implemented for all appropriate commands.  When undo/redo selected, switches back to page
Description: the operation occurred on.  Also detected during this patch that Pages were not always being freed when removed;  this fixes that as well.

Message: Fixed bugs #933 ([windows] Shift key does not work for before/after comparison) and
Description: 1023 ([windows] Ctrl key should reverse rotation direction).

Message: Fixed #910 ([windows] tool windows should not have title bars).
Fixed #967 ([windows] Start menu item should show Shotwell icon).
Fixed bug 1020 (imported photos have date January 1900).
Eliminated two string literal build warnings.
Added NO_PUBLISHING define which excludes Facebook/Flickr export on Windows.
Added a script which downloads and installs build dependencies on Windows.
For #65/#1001: Create Event now undoable.  Allison needs this to complete #964.
Enables publishing of photos to Facebook directly from Shotwell; closes ticket #180.
Updated configure script (with appropriate changes in Makefile) to assist packagers.  From Joeny Ang.
Italian translation and type from caccolangrifata@gmail.com.
Part two of #65: All adjustments in the photo editor (including each slider in the adjustments panel) are now
Description: available as undo/redo.

Message: Moved VAPI files into their own directory.
Minor fixes to the init/terminate logic.
Switching fully over to using a Singleton pattern for PhotoTable and EventTable.
First stage of #65/#1001.  This patch was getting large and I wanted to check it in.  Undo and Redo are
Description: functional for most operations on photos and renaming events.  Other operations in next commit.

Message: 1002: Loosened up the assertion that checks the pixbuf's dimensions in the pipeline.  Pixel-accuracy is too
Description: much to ask here when considering all the subsystems involved.  Now the assertions just check that the pixbuf's  dimensions are in the ballpark.

Message: Updated Windows installer generator to include SVG dependencies.
998: Now handles situation where hald is not running or ready for connections.  Shotwell will continue to run,
Description: but won't be able to detect cameras.

Message: Removed NO_SVG in the Windows build since we've figured out how to get SVG working on Windows.
batch autoenhance feature (642) added and bug 994 fixed
990: Binary dependencies fixed in Debian packaging.  Other work in prep for packaging 0.3.1.
creat new events from selected photos
altered items in DataCollections are properly re-sorted
Some changes to help package managers -- mkdir -p on every directory during install (think DESTDIR) and
Description: back-porting configure script changes made by Adam.

Message: 963: Merge button now marked as important.  Other buttons will come in when the 0.3.0 branch is merged to
Description: trunk.

Message: 963: Now marking toolbar items as important where appropriate.
Fixes unhandled exceptions caught by Vala 0.7.8.
Makefile changes for better packaging support, from a patch submitted by Matthias Clasen.
Added an #if to fix the Windows build.
added progress bar for merging over 50 photos into an event
Final merge from 0.3.0 branch to trunk.  These changes are largely related to the packaging process.
For some reason, Queryable has returned.  Bye.
adds merge events feature.  present in right-click context menu, in the edit menu, and in the toolbar.
Changelog, readme, and Debian changes in preparation of packaging.
Updated POT translations template file so that it reflects the set of strings present in the application after the shotwell 0.3 string freeze.

Description: Factored out directory-related methods from AppWindow into a new class AppDirs.   On Windows, prepend the directory containing the Shotwell executable to the PATH on startup.  This is necessary so that gconfd can find its DLLs, which live in the Shotwell executable directory.

Message: This fixes a bug Allison discovered in trunk.  Migrating it to 0.3.0.
956: Need to re-hide progress bar after pages are added to the notebook, as this requires a show_all() on it,
Description: which shows all hidden widgets.  This fixes the problem by hiding the progress_bar when necessary when the page  is switched to.

Message: 962: The full-window page was holding a ref to the Photo object after it had been deleted, triggering the
Description: assertion.  This change ensures the ref is dropped when a photo is deleted.

Message: 957: A function used within the Photo pipeline needed to be performed atomically and was not.  This fixes that
Description: problem and cleans up atomicity elsewhere in the pipeline.

Message: Added an Inno Setup script which can generate a Windows installer.
961: Fixed.  A long-running problem was that SinglePhotoPage resized the DrawingArea widget to match the
Description: viewport.  This was unnecessary (GtkViewport does this automatically) and, with certain scrollbar policies,  would cause the described problem.

Message: Changed the event signalling mode of the adjustment palette sliders from Discontinuous to Delayed.
995: Ellipses fixed when unmounting camera.  #958: Double-clicking slider and moving it is a feature of GTK.
Description: Changed code to fix crash due to reference counting/signal disconnect issues.

Message: 656: Remove dialog reworded.  Fixed an HIG issue with the dialog title.
948: Folders no longer counted as part of the import manifest.  If absolutely nothing is imported, an
Description: appropriate dialog is presented to the user.

Message: Added code so that we can find the directory where Shotwell is installed on either Linux or Windows.
Fixed a bug where a month event page was triggering an assertion when accessed immediately after it was created
Description: by an import.  This was due to Gtk.Notebook.show_all() not being called after the page was added to the notebook  (which is a no-no).  This fixes it, and hopefully ensures it's always called when a page is added.

Message: Use /bin/bash to execute configure.  This avoids a shell portability problem since
Description: different versions of /bin/sh may echo newlines differently.

Message: 728: Drag selection now works properly at the bottom of a large collection.  Related to a signed 16-bit
Description: overflow bug when GDK window grab is enabled (reported at https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=599937). Also, we discovered that signals must be disconnected manually, so have done that as well in places where  required.

Message: Removed periods after "cm" abbreviation in crop tool aspect ratio popup box. This change resolves ticket #941.
711: No full fixes for this, as it's been decided this is a Gtk issue.  However, did remove the scrollbars
Description: flashing as the window is shrunk by the user, which helps.  Also, in the investigation found some  unused/unnecessary code paths.  Also fine-tuned the readahead caching, which was not quite right.  Finally,  removing the flashing scrollbars revealed problems in fullscreen mode, and fixed that as well.

Message: Check the number of CPUs on Windows systems.
Enabled building on a Mac via GTK-OSX.
874: Increased event lull duration (event gap threshold) to 4 hours.
743: Now displaying a cancellable modal progress bar while rotating, reverting, or deleting a large number of
Description: photos at once.
On Windows, allow files to be imported by dragging them into the Shotwell window.   On Windows, added a linker flag which prevents a console window from appearing each time we run Shotwell.

Message: 899: Fixed crash on import due to faulty EXIF data.  Also fixed a bug due to recent readahead commit.
This prevents readahead in the direct edit case, which only slows it down (due to importing on the fly).  Will
Description: need to be revisited at a future point.

Message: 741: Now performing readaheads in full-window and fullscreen view with a cache filled by background threads.
Description: Also fixed some issues exposed by these readaheads in direct edit mode and fullscreen mode.

Message: Added PNG icons for Windows port.
Various changes to allow Shotwell to build on Windows.
Description: (The new .png files will arrive in a separate commit since I have them on a different machine.)

Message: generalized EventProxyPage code to StubPage, which is used to create stubs for Event pages and EventDirectory pages.
Upped to version 0.3.1 in preparation for 0.4.0 development.
Branching to complete 0.3.0 tickets.  Trunk now code repository for 0.4.0.
allows for sidebar navigation with keyboard
893 exposed a bug in the import code where a file that was not copied into the library directory (typically
Description: ~/Pictures) because it was located inside the user photos directory was deleted if the import failed.  Shotwell  was deleting the file if it was supposed to be copied but wasn't.  Now, it only deletes if file was actually  copied.

Message: 534: User now asked at end of import if they want to delete the photos on the camera.
Resolves bug #891 ("Image does not grow/shrink with window when red-eye is activated, and may crash").
I failed to add a vapi patch and binary icon file in the previous commit; this commit adds these overlooked files.
Completes implementation of feature #199 (Crop aspect ratios).
fixes for tickets 622 (tool placement in fullscreen), 835 (pixelated fullscreen image), 878 (titles persist between event pages), 666 (basic info pane padded), and 875 autoenhance shortcut)
535: Duplicates now detected on import and reported in summary to user.  This patch will check camera photos
Description: for duplicates via their EXIF/thumbnail hashes as well drag-and-drop files, either by EXIF/thumbnail (if  available) or by a full-file hash.

Message: With libgphoto 2.4.6, EXIF data is garbage from the camera, so cannot accurately count how many preview bytes
Description: have to be downloaded when updating the progress bar.  Now merely reflecting the number of loaded photos  in the progress bar.

Message: 888: This is due to the code rework for #887 and a bug in libgphoto2 2.4.6 where garbage is returned
Description: when querying for EXIF data on a camera photo.  This fixes the problem by querying for the EXIF and the  thumbnail separately.

Message: implements shift+arrow selection (393), the sidebar selection fix (877), and changes the unmount diaglog (883)
536: Toggle button on import page allows user to hide photos that have already been imported.
changed all instances of name to title, titles default to off
shift+home and shift+end now work properly.
Fixes ampersand in event tooltip bug and corrects shift+click selection to be linear.
866: Updated to work with libgee 0.5.0.  Deprecated calls now replaced with new methods.
865: Direct editing fixed.  Was not entirely integrated into the new architecture.
Added David Jeske to THANKS file.
612: (Jeske) Escape cancels current tool, then returns to collection page.  Removed "Return to Photos" from
Description: View menu.

Message: 658: (Jeske) F11 and Esc now exit fullscreen mode.

These changes make it so Shotwell starts with only the most recent event branch open, opens the tree containing an event when the event is selected, scrolls appropriately to a newly selected event in the sidebar, and maintains the expanded/collapsed state of the sidebar tree when resorting events.
859: Reflow was not occuring after import.  This fell out of some of the recent optimizations (but is fixed
Description: thanks to recent erchitecture change!)

Message: Fixed an issue where a reflow() wasn't being called when the new EventPage was realized on the screen.  This bug
Description: popped up in Allison's work on heirarchical events.

Message: 842: Fixed.  #742: Fixed.  #710: Fixed.  Empty space shown on quick drag if thumbnail not in cache.  Good
Description: enough for now.  #709: Usable but could be better.  Good enough for now.

Message: Added date hierarchy to event directory.
More work on improving UI responsiveness.  In particular, CheckerboardLayout now maintains a spatial
Description: (two-dimensional) data structure to allow for quicker traversal of its laid-out items.  This speeds up finding  items at pixel coordinates and intersections of area and items (which in turn is a boost in expose_event() and  update_visible_page()).

Message: 710: Now using threads to load thumbnails in the background.  More work to be done to close ticket, but with
Description: blocking I/O now in the background, the UI controls are much more responsive.

Message: Improves auto-enhance performance by about 25%, closes #674.
710: Some work done to improve performance of scrollbar (with large libraries).  Specifically, this introduces
Description: the difference for a ThumbnailView to have a view_altered (which requires a repaint) and a geometry_altered  (which requires a reflow in the layout).

Message: Fixes problems caused by missing photo files in slideshow.  Regresses on manual advance so that no low res image put up immediately, but that should be fixed with readahead.
824: Fixes for 0.7.7, binding updates and compiler/syntax changes.
809: Final step of model/view refactoring.  Data objects and their collections are now maintained in the
Description: classes in DataObject.vala and DataCollection.vala.  All other objects throughout the system can now access  photos and events in a unified way, and keep their own state synchronized consistently.

Message: no longer crashes when photo file source is missing

This revision implements full international support (enhancement #625) in the codebase and build system, including installation of translation files during make install. Enhancement #625 is now closed.
809: Part two of the model/view refactoring.  Photo is now integrated into the new architecture, now breaking
Description: the other half of the Queryable system for Basic Properties.  After some consideration, didn't want to fold  these changes in with the next (which integrates Page with the new architecture) because that represents another  large change, and the two together will be unwieldy.  However, the next commit will restore Basic Properties.

Message: This revision includes fully internationalized program code. Internationalization support in the build process and packaging are not yet complete.
809: This is part one of the model/view refactoring.  This adds the new DataObject and DataCollection classes
Description: which are the basis of all data objects in the system that need to be organized.  Event and EventSource were  refactored as part of this first pass.  Note that the properties sheet is broken when displaying events because  the refactoring is not complete.  The next commit (or perhaps the one after that) will fix this when Page and  its children are integrated with DataObject/DataCollection.

Message: Fixes an assertion bug in direct edit mode.  Also, direct edit now takes advantage of some scaling optimizations
Description: recently made available.

Message: Implemented basic event rename, using a dialog.
Regression: This speeds up the time it takes to display the Events Directory.
257: Removed 64-pixel thumbnails.  Do not think at this time we need to have screen-sized thumbnails.  #621
Description: and #677: Applying color transformations is much speedier.  Pipeline only runs once, to generate thumbnails, and  thumbnails are now generated in the idle queue.

Message: Added the Event class, which is akin to the Photo (now LibraryPhoto) class.  All event-related logic outside of
Description: database queries belongs here.

Message: Fixes a couple of scaling bugs exposed with the recent changes to load-and-decode.  Also, tweaks and bug-fixes
Description: in the thumbnail caching.

Message: This is all work toward #677, attempting to avoid running the pipeline when doing edit operations.  Because the
Description: pipeline must be run for generating thumbnails, that run is not avoided with this check-in.  (This may be  addressed with background threads.)  This check-in avoids the pipeline when possible with current architecture,  and attempts to reuse an old pixbuf if the user cancels the edit tool.

Message: Fixed scaled load-and-decode to properly scale images which are re-oriented and/or have a crop.  Assertions in
Description: the code guarantee that the pixbuf should not be rescaled once it leaves the pipeline.

Message: Auto-enhance sets the Shadows slider in this revision, completing implementation of enhancement #641.
Now using a scaled load-and-decode in the pipeline.  Full-window images are no longer requested at screen size
Description: and then scaled to fit the window, but rather requested at window (actually, viewport) size.  Window resizing is  done with current pixbuf until the resize completes and the pipeline is re-run.

Message: Adds a Shadows slider to the Adjustments palette, closing enhancement request #640.
Optimizations to speed up the photo viewer, including using bilinear rather than hyper interpolation for images
Description: going to the screen.

Message: Resolves #738. Fixes a bug whereby the position of the exposure slider wasn't set properly when the Adjustments palette was opened. Increases image update performance when sliders are re-positioned in the Adjustments palette.
Added remove_transformation to Photo for set_adjustment().
737: Fixes enhancement being run twice when activated while another tool is open.
Fixed a minor bug introduced in the previous revision whereby the histogram graphic in the adjustment palette failed to update in response to movement of the exposure slider.

Color adjustment and enhancement are condensed into one operation in this revision (#678). This change was effected through a major refactoring of the color transformation subsystem. This refactoring provides other performance gains throughout the color transformation subsystem.
Bug: Need a TransformablePhoto.has_transformation() to deal with a null transformations map.
Added settings toolbar button in slideshow page.  Settings dialog allows user
Description: to modify the delay (in seconds) between slideshow frames.  The slideshow delay and display basic info menu option now persist between sessions.

Message: Refactoring of the drag-select code into CollectionLayout.  This is to push drawing code out of
Description: CheckerboardPage, which holds the selection list.  This is part of the refactoring for collections.

Message: Widgetless thumbnail implementation.  This commit assists with #136.  Also added aggregate debug logging to
Description: ThumbnailCache, as its log messages interfered with performance testing.  CameraTable initializes after a delay  to shave even more time off the app startup time.

Message: Nub icon not added to last commit.
Adjustment palette now includes histogram slider controls (#615) that are automatically set by auto-enhance (#681).
All PhotoTable rows are not stored in memory, to speed up startup.  Database verification is looser now, as all
Description: photos are not verified at initialization.

Message: EventPages now loaded on-demand rather than created all at once.  A similar strategy can be used with albums.
As part of #136: CollectionPage was iterating its parent's list to ensure the same photo was not added twice to
Description: its view.  Smart!  CollectionPage now maintains a HashMap of LibraryPhoto -> Thumbnail.

Message: the basic properties display now updates with multiple selection.
Detected a bug when testing iPhone 3.0 with Rob's: the unmount failed and the unmount progress bar remained
Description: visible and the camera remained marked as busy.  This fixes that problem.  Have not been able to reproduce the  unmount problem.

Message: 670: When Shotwell first starts, it runs a verify_database() function.  This now looks for events with no
Description: end_time set (due to #665) and sets it to the exposure_time of the newest photo in the event.

Message: Gah ... corner-case in last commit.  This solves it.
669: F11 now works as it should in the Events Directory page.  Also cleaned up SinglePhotoPage to be more
Description: efficient about only creating a new pixmap when it's absolutely required.

Message: 533: Holding down the arrow key doesn't hang Shotwell any longer.  #63: Quick compare holding down the Shift
Description: key of a modified photo (works both in library and direct-edit mode).  #537: Slideshow now begins with selected  photo.  #665: Last event now marked with its end time.  #668: Toolbar now remains in-place in fullscreen mode  when using compiz.

Message: Fixed graying out Revert menu item in context menu.
Fixes various problems in direct-edit identified by Adam, including Save/Save As behavior and dialog titles,
Description: displaying a dirty asterisk and path in the title bar (a la gedit), and handling cases where a file is  unreadable or undecodable.

Message: added display basic photo info feature for single selection
Regression in the refactoring for direct-edit mode; thumbnails were being re-oriented twice when the user
Description: rotated an image.  (Caught by Allison.)

Message: 652: Shotwell will now register itself as a JPEG viewer when installed.  Fixed About box.
Edit/Undo -> Photo/Revert to Original.  A better solution in the future is for EditingHostPage to have its own
Description: PhotoMenu and PhotoContextMenu that is shared by the subclasses.

Message: 647: Context menu added to direct editing page.  Queries before losing changes to photo.  Fixed thumbing
Description: through directory.

Message: Added Save and Save As ... to direct editing window.  Moved more functionality from LibraryPhoto into
Description: TransformablePhoto.  Thumbing through directory now operational.

Message: implements one-touch, toggle-able auto-enhance functionality; resolves ticket #62
Fixed mechanics of replacing photo object displayed in full-screen view.
First stab at direct photo editing (#187); can open a single file and edit it with our tool set.  Fullscreen
Description: mode supported.  No save feature or directory traversal yet.

Message: 397: Fixed crop tool buttons for GNOME HIG.
Broke PhotoPage into EditingHostPage and LibraryPhotoPage, in preparation for direct editing.  Also introduced
Description: PhotoCollection, a grouping interface for EditingHostPage to generically move through a group of photos.

Message: Moved PhotoTransformer into TransformablePhoto, which is now properly in the inheritance tree.  Also prepped
Description: PhotoPage for using TransformablePhoto rather than Photo (which is now LibraryPhoto), so it can be reused for  direct edit mode.

Message: Exeption enum was accepted as int for get_pixbuf() parameter ... caused adjust tool to display psychadelic
Description: image.

Message: Callers to PhotoTransformer.get_pixbuf now must specify a scale, to discourage pipeline transformations of
Description: unscaled pixbufs.  Support added for retrieving pixbufs at screen size, which is adequate for most display  operations.  Beefed-up the get_preview_pixbuf() method, which encourages using lower-quality but  fully-transformed pixbufs when possible.

Message: restructured queryable interfaces to return static types
Part two of staged commit to refactor for #189: new PhotoTransformer class deals with transformations without
Description: knowledge of how they're backed.

Message: Refactoring in preparation of direct-edit window (#187): AppWindow now broken into AppWindow & LibraryWindow.
Adds the Queryable class and classes for boxing stucts, changes Photo's
Description: query_filesize to get_filesize, and moves set/get_dimensions to Exif from PhotoExif.

Message: 600: Now using user-defined pictures directory for default library storage.
Closes ticket #77. A dynamically-updating image histogram is now displayed in the Adjustment palette.
372: Import DND modifier keys.  Note that Move is not implemented, for reasons I detail in #603.
Added instrumentation to Photo pixbuf pipeline to measure absolute time of each stage.  Also added feature to
Description: allow caller to declare a scale for the pixbuf; Photo can perform the scale at an opportune time and reduce  overhead in certain operations.  Also fixed bug where the Thumbnail objects in the entire system were being  resized when the slider moved; now, only those that are in view are resized, and the others resize when they  come into view.

Message: 380: X server corruption when selecting with compositing WM fixed.  Different technique used, which should actually be faster and results in nicer presentation.
Previous version segfaults on 64-bit builds.  Issue is a bad binding for KeyFile; see
Description: http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=588104  KeyFile is only used in the database in PhotoTable.  It  appears the adjustment code (when compiled for release) exposed the binding problem.  Now using a custom vapi  until the binding is fixed.

Message: Not quite ... had to update toolbar controls as well.
504: Arrow keys move quicker through slideshow by using a 360 thumbnail for initial display.  #581: FP compiler
Description: optimizations now included in release build.

Message: 506: Sped up opening photos by using large thumbnail is initial image.  #580: "Copy files to library" option
Description: now available in File / Import.

Message: resolved bug #591 : assertion fails when null color adjustment (i.e. all sliders set to zero) is applied
78: added adjust control manipulating exposure, saturation, temperature and tint
439: Resorting photos with large collection does not take so much time.  This one has been bugging me for a
Description: long time.  I replaced SortedList's inane insertion sort with a less-inane binary insertion sort.  Photo now  caches exposure_time to speed up comparisons, as going out to the database every time was too expensive.  Both  changes result in a marked improvement for the user.  Also made Sort By Exposure Time / Descending the default,  as that's more interesting for the user.  Also spotted a subtle bug in fullscreen window; fixed.

Message: 464: Makefile no longer broken for incremental builds (hard-tab empty command fix).  #451: --debug | --release
Description: in ./configure.  #452: Release build is default (-g -O2).

Message: 441: Ubuntu packaging.  #460: Cross-compilation under Launchpad.  #461: Man page.  #462: Debian menu file.
Description: 530: Tarball provides top-level directory.  #538: configure.in -> configure.mk  #544: Proper "make distclean". 554: Makefile builds .tar.gz.  #572: Only require libgee 0.1.3.

Message: Resolved bugs #547 ("Crop reticle leaves artifacts in gutter") and #548 ("Crop reticle can't be gripped if dropped in gutter")
fixed bugs #551 and #552: import/export menus now have ellipses and dialog titles now match command names
fixed bugs #551 and #552: import/export menus now have ellipses and dialog titles now match command names
added enhancement #527: import from file menu option
Need to check for null with exif.
fixed bug #588: delete photos confirmation now uses Cancel and Delete, buttons.  changed dialog icon to Warning and edited dialog message
fix bug that last checkin caused--added 1900 to date
fixed bug #502: extra space in event dates
Imported photos are sorted by exposure time as they're imported.
Crop code refactored into its own class of abstract type.  This allows PhotoPage to host more tools in the future via an abstract interface.  #456: THANKS file added.
Fixes importing from mass storage devices, especially card readers.
437: Select All in camera import view.
435: Sidebar refactored into own class.  This will pay dividends later when more features come on line that incorporate more pages and more sidebar requirements.
433: Slideshow now paints high-quality without stepping up the improvement.
205: Sort events by date, reflected in sidebar and in the events directory page.
Upping version number to 0.1.2, for next release.
Made changes for Shotwell to depend on gee-1.0 alone and not vala-1.0 (save to compile).
Fixes compile errors with valac 0.7.4.  Explicitly checks for vala 0.7.3 or above in Makefile for building,
Description: separating the check from packages Shotwell depends on at runtime.

Message: An attempt to fix #380, although still reported in the wild.  This, however, fixes a serious problem in how the
Description: selection rubberband is painted.

Message: Fixed version number in COPYING file.
Fixed bug where was not switching to Camera view when desktop indicated a new attached device.  Fixed stepper
Description: buttons on scrollbar to now work.

Message: 337: Added README, INSTALL, etc. files.  #378: More thorough About box.  #389: Icon licensing information added to AUTHORS.  #413: Copyright/licensing added to all source files.
392: Arrow keys now available in all checkerboard views (Events and Camera included).  #342: Shift+Click now selects all in smallest rectangle.
289: Check dependency versions, using Intrepid as base build system.  Vala 0.7.3 required, however.
Improved installation: Application icon now installed.
Removed Gtk call that was 2.16 or above.  Changed .desktop file to not
Description: launch terminal window.

Message: 396: Right-click on crop tool window no longer crashes.  #339: Data directory now ~/.shotwell.  #394: Arrow keys to move next/previous photo in full-window and fullscreen mode.
308: Icons for all current buttons.  #388: Help/Contents URL.
348: Now darkening area outside of crop rectangle.  Lightening it didn't look right; this can be easily changed, however.
370: Photo file deleted when removed from library.  User confirms with dialog.
369: All imported files are now copied into the user's photo library.
Fixed up the About dialog a little bit.  Still more work to be done on it.
314: Show photos in full-window view as they're imported.  #315: Stop Import button.  #312: Drag-and-drop file import looks and acts the same as camera import.
Refactoring to prep for import queue page.
Fixed an edge case where the user exits the app during an import and import is not cancelled.

183: Major improvements to importing infrastructure to accumulate errors, report them all at once to the user, and to import from camera on-the-fly rather than copying all photos to local FS then importing.
352: Crop tool window no longer steals focus.
96: App exit now quick no matter if closed with close button or File/Quit.
338: "Cameras" row in sidebar only visible when cameras actually present.
344: Use arrow keys to move between photos, as well as Home/End.  Enter will load single-selected photo in full-window view.
341: Zoom level shared between events and Photos view.
Decided to keep selection banding code inside CheckerboardPage, so CollectionLayout can focus on layout.
346: Context menu now available for multiple selected items.
347: All toolbar buttons now have tooltips.
345: Home/End/PgUp/PgDn now available to move the viewport around.  Sidebar does not maintain focus to make this happen.  This may be revisited later, esp. for accessibility review.
Further file organization in preparation for the first tarball.
340: Logging suppressed by default.  Set environment variable SHOTWELL_LOG to see all, SHOTWELL_DEBUG, SHOTWELL_MESSAGE, etc. to see by level.
350: Ok button is now default in Export Photo dialog.
342: Fixes assertion crash where item was not selected on mouse-up due to unimplemented modifier key.
Minor fix to crop tool and DnD.  Fixed regression with crop tool window placement.
296: Now with configure script to set installation prefix.  Also, moved all .ui files into separate directory.  Shotwell determines whether to use local or installed resources files at runtime.
Fixed bug reported by Vadim Peretokin.
Some cleaning up, esp. how groups of IDs are reported by the database objects.
151: Using square brackets rather than +/- for thumbnail zoom accelerators.
259: Database versioning.  Also some long-needed refactoring of database code.
Better image generation when exporting.  Cleaned up photo updates (performed when external image change is detected).
294: Off-white sidebar.  #88: Blue photo selection color.

229: Basic export via drag-and-drop.  More work can be done on the generated JPEG (if it's not simply a copy of the file stored in the library, i.e. it's been modified).  #293: Darker background, although not configurable at this time.

189: Bug in libgphoto2 + pausing between unmount and camera_init() solved problem.  #301: Vala 0.7.3 resolves.  #192:Not a dirty flag issue, but iPhone changing its mount point name every time it's locked.  Resolved.  #196:Imported photos now saved in heirarchical directories, and unique filenames are guaranteed.
292: Menu item capitalization fixed.  Now using Rotate Right/Left for menu labels.
282: Cancel in crop tool window doesn't remove the crop.  #283: Standard icons in crop tool window buttons.  #64: Revert to original.
Prettier crop tool.  Simplified some of the invalidation code.  Not going to mark #203 as done until more discussion.

Fixed issues with crop tool in fullscreen mode.  Added opacity to the fullscreen toolbar and sized it smaller.  Opacity only works with a compositing WM.  Currently there's some flicker which needs investigation.
Crop toolbar window now follows window if moved or resized, unless the user explicitly moves it to a position on the screen.
Fixed an off-by-one error when rotating and derotating crop dimensions.

Major overhaul to improve responsiveness of editing photos and generating new thumbnails.  All modifications to the photo stored in the database are stored in the photo's original, unrotated coordinate system, which means they do not have to be adjusted whenever the image is rotated.  Some refactoring, including making Orientation a powerhouse of its own.

Major improvement to performance when moving and resizing the crop tool.  For now, the crop tool is embedded in the PhotoPage class; should be broken out in the near future.  Probably will do when another editing tool is introduced and the abstractions become more necessary.
201: Rule-of-thirds lines.  However, moving and resizing the crop is now unacceptably slow.
This fixes maintaining the crop for rotated images.  Now, crop is rotated along with image.
Fixed bug where crop would fail on small photos.
Fixed a bug in photo removal.
Performance boost on resizing thumbnails in view ... came to me over lunch.

Major refactoring in preparation for photo editing.  New Photo object centralizes pixbuf generation and photo manipulation, and introduces GObject signals into the system so various interested parties (esp. various pages) are notified when a photo is modified or removed.  Also refactored Dimensions struct, as what started out as a utility record has become a first-class citizen of Shotwell.  Also, while refactoring, went ahead and made changes to reflect Yorba's coding style (i.e. camelCase for variables -> underscored_names).  In the process, knocked out #198: Databases and thumbnail cache always in sync with modifications.  #202: Black-and-white shading with crop tool.
Basic crop UI functionality, although some UI spottiness and crop is not persisted.
191: Accelerators for fullscreen view.  Crop button (but no implementation!) added.
Fixed bug where rotating a photo in fullscreen was not reflected in the events directory page.
Now refreshing files & folders during import to workaround #192.  Optimization in CollectionLayout to deal with now having multiple pages with large thumbnail collections.
This fixes the problem with fullscreen occassionally not displaying the initial image.
177: Fullscreen F11 with floating control bar.  #71: Let use select key photo for each event.  Added gphoto macros to prevent worrisome compiler warnings.
67: Events.  Lots of refactoring to accomdate database and UI changes.  Another valac bug found in
Description: CollectionLayout.vala, probably related to generics.  Will fix soon.

Message: Lots of changes working toward events, including some database work.
172: Now handle situations where we need to ask user to unmount camera (or tell them to close application
Description: holding the lock).

Message: 170: Auto-unmount on startup (when notified by nautilus).  #171: Auto-unmount when running and notified by
Description: nautilus.  Added (sudo) make install and (sudo) make uninstall.  Added .desktop file (necessary for nautilus  integration).

Message: 167: libunique.  #168:Switch to camera view on startup.  #169:Switch to camera view when user attaches on while
Description: running.  Also, get_instance() to reflect that Shotwell is single-window app.

Message: 150: Progress bar is in better shape.  Fine-tuning discussed in #92.  #145 and #146:Cameras detected
Description: at initialization and runtime, and appear as children of "Cameras" in the sidebar.

Message: 150: Ugly progress bar, but it's there.  Useful even for development to see what's going on.  Finer-detailed UI
Description: work to come.

Message: 147: Fixed, although icons would be nice.  #149:Import in background added.  Rotate buttons now have text.
138: Actions and ActionGroups now handled in intelligent manner.  Also added moveable thumb between sidebar and
Description: view pages.

Message: 57: Import photos from camera.  Tons of refactoring to share layout and functionality between multiple pages.
Photo full-window view available by double-clicking on photo.  libgphoto.vapi.
Forgot to commit icons in last update.  Also added first steps toward sorting.
59: Rotate photo w/ EXIF, including toolbar button.
JPEG/EXIF rotations implemented and stored in the photo file itself.  Further work to be done before marking off
Description: the ticket.

Message: Backed out a strategy of incrementally loading EXIF data.
libexif bindings built and now in use throughout app.  Need to clean up display before claiming tickets.  Also,
Description: first stab at adding a full-page view of photos.

Message: Fixed a corner case in the layout code.
Major tune-up of collection layout as well as appearance.  This scales well to 1200 photos, although resizing
Description: the thumbs at that number leaves something to be desired.  Fixes #89.

Message: More work to be done for aesthetics, but this fixes #93 in a big way.
Fixed a bug where the thumbnails were not improved after a repack().
Description: Also, timing repacks.

Message: Speed improvements for large photo collections.  More work to be done.
Description: 95: Three-tier thumbnail system in memory (JPEG -> unscaled pixbuf -> scaled pixbuf).  #94: Fixed.

Message: Improvement of scaling speed.  Now storing three persistent thumbnail
Description: caches (360px, 128px, 64px).  How these work need to be reviewed.

Message: 55: Slider control added.  Also, refactored code so CollectionPage
Description: provides menu bar and tool bar.  Eventually AppWindow will become a  controller merely switching between various pages (views).

Message: 85: Added right-click/Remove on thumbnail.  #87: Photo scaling is
Description: improved by generating higher-quality thumbnails to disk and better  in-memory scaling.  #90 and #91: Detailed in Wiki, implemented  throughout.

Message: Thumbnail dimensions are now stored in a table rather than fetched from
Description: disk and examined.  This speeds up init time, esp. with large  collections.

Message: Updated the cache to store JPEG data in memory and convert to pixbufs on
Description: the fly.  Thumbnails only hold pixbufs when they're on screen, otherwise  they're tossed.  Fixed #86.

Message: Added adjustable thumbnail sizing, however, need to add UI slider for
Description: ticket to be marked off.  Implemented a persistent thumbnail cache. Began work to have thumbnail objects on-screen load and unload their  pixbufs dynamically.

Message: First stab at #54.  Can now distinguish which photo has been clicked on,
Description: prelim work for selecting photos.

Message: Cleanup.  Thumbnails now bottom-aligned with white text.
